review_content: 2014 rating. Pours a foamy bubbly head but doesn't stay too long. Has a clear yellowish appearance. No lacing whatsoever. Aromas of lime, grains and malts. Flavours are fairly sweet, some lemony lime notes. Refreshing and low abv brew for hot summer days, but not something I would drink any other time.
A limit shandy with hints of beer. Thin and more than a little too much chemical character.

From Jul 2007

Purchased as a single for US$1.49 at Liquor Shed in Casper.

This pours from 12oz bottle a pale gold with a small head of foam. That soon shrinks to just a few islands in the middle of my glass.

The smell reminds me of a wine cooler. Fruity, lemon lime.

The taste has a lot of lemon and lime flavour to it until about midway through and through the finish where it's quite watery.
I'm glad I only bought the 1 bottle. ;^)

330ml bottle from Cellarbrations, Main beach, Surfers Paradise
Pale straw with OK head.
Aroma is lime with sulfur/DMS note.
Slight bitterness with thin watery bottle - more of a Radler/shandy.
For thirst quenching purposes only.

Straight from bottle. Another lawnmower beer. Refreshing when you are hot and wish to down something quickly. Cold filtered water though might do the trick even better. Also good to put six or so in the Esky when you have a large gathering as there is always someone who will prefer this to beer (who has never had anything other than a macro lager). E.g. me 15 years ago.
355ml bottle. Old rate. Shitty macro alcopop meets adjunct lager bullshit, avoid
355ml bottle. Clear golden, effervescent bubbles and a foamy white head. "Flavors" are corn syrup, cardboard and some bland artificial flavouring. Light body, fizzy carbonation, watery texture.
This is a summer beer for the beach. It is a clear pale yellow colour and tastes like lime.

Single 355 ml bottle from the grab bin at Park Lane Liquor Store, served in a footed Big Rock lager glass. Part one of a mini-series of light lagers, ticked and rated. Pours a highly carbonated, golden straw yellow with a pearly white head that pops, crackles, and vanishes, leaving some lace web fragments. Aroma is sweet cereals, lime, and grassiness; flavor is faintly lager-like with dominant, semi-ersatz lime. Thin mouthfeel, but finishes crisply, though the strong lime essence sticks around longer than I’d care for. A serviceable cerveza with nothing horribly off-putting; it’ll quench thirst handily. Note: this review is for "Miller Chill Lime" found in Canada, which has no mention of "Chelada Style" or salt on the label; judging by other reviews below, "chelada" apparently is Spanish for "revolting".

Bottle: I’ll be honest. Back before I liked craft beer & drank solely for the social purposes of drinking, Bud Light Lime was my beer of choice. I didn’t really care for Bud Light (aka BEER AS I KNEW IT) back then, so the Lime helped to distract the fact that I was essentially drinking rain water. I remember trying Labatt Blue Light Lime for the first time & thinking it was even better. I also remember seeing Miller Chill for the first time & getting excited like a school girl, only to be extremely let down compared to its two competitive brethren. By far the worst of the three (we are talking bronze medalist of the Special Olympics, here). Lime is actually the heaviest but comes off as way too artificial, distracting, & cloying. Weird salty notes don’t help either. Kind of vegetal. Astringent, metallic. Shitty. Honestly if you want a MACRO MADE lime lager, LBL-Lime is the way to go.

330ml bottle. No glass. Hardly any aroma! No lime. Pale yellow in bottle, zero carbonation. Mineral water feel and taste. Where’s the lime? Aftertaste is a little vegetal, salt and then a tiny bit of citrus. I mean tiny! The XXXX lager with lime is much better. On the plus side, this is drinkable. Unlike MGD.

Huge thanks to adnielsen for pooning this mega wæl for me. Big props. Drank this God nectar straight from the bottle. Because it is clear glass, I could easily deduce the clear, yellow color of the liquid. Sticking my cocaine infested nostril into the bottle opening, I smell limes and corn. Taste is sweet. Flavors of artificial lime and creamed corn. So, so beautiful.

"the light pee flavored "beer" under the lime flavoring is pretty nasty stuff (like most miller beers) so it’s no surprise that any kind of lime flavors (artificial or not) are actually a big improvement. allows one to be able to finish the beer...but that’s about it."
Wow does the lime flavor ever come out when it’s piss warm. Not much to see here but water and lime flavor with a touch of beer... Is what it is a summer quencher but really light.

355 ml bottle. Pours a clear, pale golden color with a thin white head. Aroma is lime and grain. Sweet flavour of lime, corn and some faint hops in the finish. Light body with watery texture and soft carbonation.

2014 rating. Pours a foamy bubbly head but doesn't stay too long. Has a clear yellowish appearance. No lacing whatsoever. Aromas of lime, grains and malts. Flavours are fairly sweet, some lemony lime notes. Refreshing and low abv brew for hot summer days,…
A limit shandy with hints of beer. Thin and more than a little too much chemical character.
From Jul 2007…
330ml bottle from Cellarbrations, Main beach, Surfers Paradise Pale straw with OK head.…

Straight from bottle. Another lawnmower beer. Refreshing when you are hot and wish to down something quickly. Cold filtered water though might do the trick even better. Also good to put six or so in the Esky when you have a large gathering as there is always…
355ml bottle. Old rate. Shitty macro alcopop meets adjunct lager bullshit, avoid
355ml bottle. Clear golden, effervescent bubbles and a foamy white head. "Flavors" are corn syrup, cardboard and some bland artificial flavouring. Light body, fizzy carbonation, watery texture.
This is a summer beer for the beach. It is a clear pale yellow colour and tastes like lime.

"the light pee flavored "beer" under the lime flavoring is pretty nasty stuff (like most miller beers) so it’s no surprise that any kind of lime flavors (artificial or not) are actually a big improvement. allows one to be able to finish the beer...but that’s about it."
Wow does the lime flavor ever come out when it’s piss warm. Not much to see here but water and lime flavor with a touch of beer... Is what it is a summer quencher but really light.

355 ml bottle. Pours a clear, pale golden color with a thin white head. Aroma is lime and grain. Sweet flavour of lime, corn and some faint hops in the finish. Light body with watery texture and soft carbonation.
Clearly, this was brewed to compete with Bud Light Lime. It is inferior to its competitor. It is too salty and grainy. The stuff has to be ice cold to be tolerable.

Bottle thanks to NielsenRatings197. Pour is amazingly clear with a white head that does fast. Crystal clear light yellow. Crazy. Nose is light lime and almost salty. Taste is the same. Very thin and highly carbonated. Wish it was summer.
Crystal clear but that is it. Taste like what a margarita would taste like after it sat on your table overnight cuz you were too drunk to finish it. Combine that with bile and good to go...yuck.
Tastes like fruit extract mixed with shitty lager. At least this stuff is cheap.
Ressemble a la bud light lime est pire encore je trouve. Vraiment pas une bonne bière, très artificiel!!!

Fucken bottle @ home, picked up at Supermarket Liquor Foco. Pours a clear yellow appearance with a nice lasting white head. Lemon/lime, skunky aroma. A touch salty, Sprite/lemon-lime soda, spritzy flavor. Pretty refreshing but not as good as Bud Light Lime.

Poured a clear pale straw colour with a one-finger white foamy head that retained OK but laced poorly. High carbonation – very bubbly and gassy. Aroma moderately strong of artificial lime. Taste of semi-sweet lime and not much else. No bitterness. Light body bordering in watery. Sweet artificial lime finish. No real hint it’s a beer or beer based. On a par with Miller Chill Lemon and not for me.
Worse than Bud Light Lime. This beer has a very artifical lime taste that is just too hard to get over.
Bottle sold as miller chill,clear yellow with a limeade snocone flavor, not much in the aroma but lime

Bière blonde de 4 % d’alcool. Elle possède un odorat de bière commerciale, mais avec un mélange de lime-citron. Elle ne possède aucun col au versement. Elle possède un bon goût de lime, autant en bouche qu’en finale. Excellente, simple et rafraîchissante !

341ml bottle. In Canada, this is still Miller Chill Lime.This fad must be stopped. Please. You can buy beer, and a lime and put them together yourself. This pre-limed beer is no better than buying pre-mixed kool-aid. This is MGD 64 that someone dissolved lime Jello into. Yum.

Smells of strong lime. The lime definitely masks any off flavored in the beer. I don't know why it gets so hated on though since it is definitely refreshing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Yikes. Pours a light straw color with a white head. Smell of hay and lime. Drinks like carbonated water with artificial lime flavoring, but just a hint of it. Thought this could replace water on this hot day...

12oz bottle into my novelty Bubba Gump lager glass that lights up in green, blue, red and, wait for it, in orange.   pours paler than pale straw with white head and noticeable lacing.  Nose is lime and that salty agent in Margaritas.  A second whiff smells of corn.  Flavor accents the lime and the low quality lager that is underneath it.  I think a little more lime (or other flavors) would mask the weaker qualities better.  Easy to drink and refreshing.  I’m already thinking poolside with clammy hands do to bottle/glass condensation.  Lacking in taste.  I’m a sucker for fruity beers, but this is disappointing.  super thin body.

12oz bottle. Pours a light yellow color, nice carbonation, small white head, with some sticky lacing left behind. The nose is malty, with some hops, and slightly sour. The taste is slightly sweet, malty, slight hop note.

12oz bottle poured into a shaker. Pours a very clear, very pale yellow with just a very little bit of bright white head. Aroma of lime, grains and a little skunk. Taste is very lightly tart. Mostly grains, with some salty lime and a little skunk. Light bodied with a very thin texture. Fizzy carbonation and really nothing to speak of for a finish. Overall, it’s ok. Very sesionable and good for mowing the lawn on a hot summer day.
Greenish yellow.  Smells like lime.  Tastes like Miller with lime.  A great yardwork beer.  Perfect for those 100 plus days where you’re trimming trees or working your butt off outside.

Bière blonde très pâle, qui semble effrayée par ce qui pourrait être de la mousse, parce qu’un jus de pommes en fait plus. En la rapprochant du nez, j’ai eu un mouvement de recul. Comme si elle était contaminée, mais en même temps, l’odeur artificielle de lime vient nous titiller les narines. Lorsqu’on la boit, on a l’impression d’un Perrier à la lime. C’est aqueux, pétillant et aromatisé. (339-050912)

Drank from the bottle.  Light straw color.  Grainy and lime aroma.  Flavor is lime with artificial sweetness.  Reminds me of fruit loops.  Light bodied with crisp carbonation.  Very refreshing, but not much else to say.

Bouteille transparente. Bière blonde dorée avec des arômes de fausse lime. La bouche est mince et les saveurs sont franchement mauvaise. Ajouter une lime à une Corona est 100 fois meilleure que cette merde. Bue sous le nom de Miller Chill Lime.
355ml bottle. A rather ordinary beer, made slightly interesting because of the lime. A lawnmower beer.
golden with small head. i expected the worst, but it wasn’t bad. bland and watery, but unoffensive.

Bottle 355ml.
Pours very clear blond, almost transparent. Low white head. Aroma: lime, weird vegetal. Taste: lime, water. Overall: refreshing, sligthly crisp. Thin.
Bottle to pint. My wife bought a 6er, and it’s a tick. It’s awful. The best attribute is the smell, and it ain’t good. No thanks!
Bottle 341 ml. Clear pale yellow with almost no head and no lacing. Aroma of artificial lemon. Taste of lemon soap. Boring.
decent ’chelada style’ beer. would say the saying ’you get what you pay for’ comes in here.

Been drinking a lot of these lately, $2.99-$3.99 a six a the local hy-vee. Piss yellow with a big fizzy white head that runs away quickly, just like soda. Tastes and smells like watery malted fake lime juice. Finishes dry, fizzy. Good.
Take a glass and fill half of it with Bud Light Lime, fill the remainder of the glass with water. Boom...Miller Chill.
Pours a bubbly yellow. Beer flavoured water. With the slightest hint of lime. Barely detectable.

Bottle. Fizzy, sugary, acidic. Somewhat sewagy... (okay, I’ve never tasted sewage, I swear, but I’m sure it’s an apt description) I’m not getting the refreshing taste they’re aiming for here either. I had this in 25 degree weather and it still failed to have any redeeming qualities. Blech.
Drank from 12oz bottle. Sour, lime-y scent, kind of smells like urine. Clear pale yellow with no head. Sour carbonated flavor, kind of like lemonade. Lemon aftertaste, a little sour.

[bottle]
"Unique lime taste"? I guess it’s really, "unique because you don’t have to put your own lime in it." I’m not accustomed to drinking light beer with lime, but I’m pretty sure a fresh lime would be far superior. Typical watery light beer with some faint citrus accent. Mineral watery with so much carbonation that you can barely taste the faint lime. Thanks but no thanks.

4% lime no salt version. Not much of a smell fluffy head and mabye a super light fart smell. 2 finger head on quicker pour. veary carbionaded. heavy bodied is there lots of hops? makes me burrp a bit and after 1st qulp. cAN taste some lime but taste more of a lime pop or lime mineral water but not in a good way. Not worst thing I had but dont like cheer’s.

Pours gold with a quickly fading head.
Aroma of lime, stale sweet and old socks. Wow it really is quite horrible.
Flavours include initial lime followed by hay and vegetal notes. Not as bad as the aroma.
Way too much carbonation, and the body is pretty watery.
Bottle. This beer is nothing awesome; however, I can drink it.  It’s almost like a margarita type beer.  Salty.. like an alcoholic gatorade.
Had one of these at a friends house and it wasn’t good. Taste like a standard light beer with a bit of lime, which honestly just makes it worse.

Miller Chill has a thin, white head and a clear, pale straw appearance, with a surprising amount of lacing left down the glass. The aroma is of grain, bread, and lime juice, and the taste is of water, lime juice, and light beer. The mouthfeel is light and watery, and Miller Chill finishes crisp, clean, and surprisingly refreshing and drinkable. Except for the thin body aspect of it, this beer tastes pretty good to me. I recommend giving it a try.

NOTE: This beer was reformulated and repackaged in 2009. This website does NOT reflect that change.

RJT

355ml bottle 

4.0% ABV 

I tried this beer on October 15, 2011 at a friend’s house.  The beer poured a translucent light gold colour with a huge genourous short-lived white head.  The aroma was very citrusy mixed with hints of sewage.  The mouthfeel was watery with mild carbonation (despite the apparent effervescence in the glass).  The flavour was weak lime, old grains, and metal.  Not enjoyable, and nothing I would ever buy for myself!

Pours a clear yellow with a bubbly white head. Minimal taste with a hint of lime. I found this one surprisingly refreshing and enjoyed the aftertaste. I could see grabbing one of these after a hot day working outside.
Appearance is a clear yellow. Aroma is sweet malt. Taste is a poor lime malt drink. Overall not great even compared to Bud Light Lime.
I really didnt like this beer, it is in no comparison to bud light lime and leaves a funky after taste in your mouth.
I struggle to even find enough words to describe. It literally just tastes like subpar light beer with lime flavor added in. Stay away - stay far away.

Bottle.  Slightly different label than that in the picture - no note of "Chelada Style".  Date on the neck:  09/19/11.  A pale piss-yellow pour with a smallish off-white head.  An artificial aroma of limy salt water that only gets more and more disgustingly sweet as things warm up.  Practically no body - almost like seltzer water with about as much effervescence.  There is a flavor of lime seltzer water as well.  Or is it watered-down 7up?  Maybe some hints of grain and corn here and there.  Makes me want some chips & salsa.
Aroma of lime, thats it.. Not much worth noting it doesn’t taste much and is pretty bad.

Why?? So I’m sitting here at a red neck wedding watching the 250 guests just pound this crap thinking this is the greatest thing ever, so I say to myself “self lets go slumming and review this shit beer”. I hate myself.  Ok I’m not going to lie I didn’t think this shit was gross, but it’s far from good doesn’t taste like beer, or have any redeeming quality what’s so ever. Clear piss gold, no aroma except for faint whiffs of watered down lime. Taste is water with hints of corn and watery lime. That is all there is to say about it, no really there is nothing ells, it boring, watery, and bland. I can see why its popular this hall is boiling fucking hot and drinking this is like drinking a glass of ice cold water with slight flavor. I think I might go grab another…………………………………………………………..I’ll have a double gin & tonic please!

Can. Hard to rate this since it displays no beer characters whatsoever. Tastes exactly like lime Perrier. Nothing can distinguish this from lime Perrier. So...it’s certainly not gross but drinking this is pretty much an excuse for guys who are scared of beer to drink lime Perrier and get away with it. How do I rate lime Perrier on this site? I’m taking a shot at it. 

The pour is yellow, surprisingly not clear, with a forced carbonated sud head. Nose is lime Perrier, surprise, with perhaps some corn and grain flavors to remind you it is macro lager. Taste is lime Perrier, surprise. Though I would say this is not as lime juice heavy as Bud Light Lime, which is actually quite nice. Palate is tart and mildly citric. So, not bad really.
Not much real beer flavor. Dominated by a generic citrus flavor and aroma, reminds me of Trix cereal. No real hop or malt presence, but I suppose its easy to drink on a hot day.
Bottle at a party. Pours clearish gold. White head. Nose/taste of artificial sugar, artificial lime juice and corn. Some metallic notes. Grainy watery mouth feel. Weak body.

355ml bottle. Sold simply as "Miller Chill" in Canada. Possibly even less lime flavour in this than there was lemon in the Miller Chill Lemon. Thought is pains me to say it, this didn’t even stand up to Moose Lime or Bud Light Lime. I’ll give it a 2 in taste merely because it wasn’t offensive, it just wasn’t anything. If it was free and there was no 7-Up available I’d consider drinking it again.

Smell reminding of time when waste pipe back up and spill on floor of cousin Azad’s house. It take many woman many moons to get smell out of living area and return to normal.  Tasting of 2 week old goat after family festival or even wifes rotten Kapsa dish.  I am still wish to get the taste of this chilly beer from my mouth.
Once, before a colonoscopy, I had to drink a sparkling citrus laxative to clear out the pipes.  Miller Chill tastes just like that laxative. (2008)

Bottle from Suspect on Garage Sale 2011 Eve...hey, it was free. Other than stating that this "fruit beer" most likely has zero fruit content, it really wasn’t offensive. It’s certainly nothing I would purchase willingly but it was not terrible. Just very thin across the board and lacking in "beer" qualities.

A: The beer pours a perfectly translucent pale yellow color with a thin layer of white head and a lot of carbonation bubbles.

S: Smells awesome. Rotten corn, burning plastic, fake lime juice. A little bit of a diaper aroma in there too. Has a bit of a stale corn/tortilla chip thing going on.

T: This is like a mixture of crappy limeade and light lager (which it pretty much is). Sweet fake lime flavor and a lot of sugar. The corn is quite present, but does not add anything positive to this beer.

M: The body is extremely light with a very high level of carbonation.

D: This is just awful. Normally I can stand a bad light lager, but the addition of lime flavoring to this just made it even worse.
Light lime flavor, more like an alcoholic 7-Up than a beer really, not disgusting, but also not a good beer.
This beer is not pleasing at all. Much rather prefer a corona with lime. This does not do the trick

This beer is cheap. That is the extent of the positives when it comes to this swill. I wish that all beers would be fine enough to consume and listen to Louis Prima while snuggled up with your best girls buttcheeks, but this does not qualify. When I drink this - i wish for many other things in a beverage such as taste and joy. With this beer - i think that they often serve this to people who are withholding government secrets and is akin to waterboarding. Should you come across a situation where this is the available beverage - do yourself a favor and just dehydrate and go buzz-less as this is far superior to drinking this elephant piss. This beer smells and tastes like foul urine strained through a sweatsock after being vomited on by a homeless person. Proceed with great caution or just run for your life.

Bouteille 355ml. De couleur dorée-jaune et claire. Nez fruité (lime), léger de grains de malt pâle avec des notes herbeuses (gazon mouillé) et des traces de maïs sucré. Mince en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et croustillant ainsi qu’une texture aqueuse. Léger-moyen goût de lime lors de l’entrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un léger goût de grains de malt pâle avec des traces de maïs sucré puis en finale l’on retrouve des notes aqueuses. Post-goût court, aux faibles notes fruitées (zest de lime).

Almost no head, weak gold body. Aroma of fake lime and grass. Taste is sour lime pop with a cardboard beer finish, then a cloying rice sweetness. Just crappy all around - give me a BL Lime anyday, or even better yet, a proper beer!

Appearance: light yellow. Doesn’t even try at any semblance of a head or lace. Meager paper thin ringlet. Swirls with nothing else except overly rambunctious carbonation.


Nose: lemon and cola; much like a sprite or 7-Up. The citrus is there in all its artificial chemically laden fallacy. Roses lime juice; sickenly thick and sweet. Artificial sweetener. Zero discernable malt and hop character.


Palate: spritely, in a carbonated sense of the word/brand. Seltzer water with a splash of artificial lime juice. Very watery with no finish. Lingering sense of wetness atop my tongue which reminds my tastebuds that they are experiencing something and that something happens to have practically no taste. Fizzed up roses lime juice. Stale crackers are a feeble whisper, the only ghost of a hint that this is a beer.


Final Thoughts: I get it, and yet I really don’t get it. Beer is beer because it has flavor, diversity, personality, ingenuity, history, culture, a store. Junk like this has nothing except empty faddish already half-dead marketability to the lowest most homogenized common denominator. If I wanted spritely fizzy limey water I’d get me some nice tonic, a fresh lime, squeeze, stir, sup, and enjoy.

This "White Bread" poured a crystal clear, light yellow colour with a bright white head. To the nose there are scents of lime, candy and grass. First swig was almost like beer cut in half with water. Very light lime flavour with a little corn. Finish was limey with corn lasting too long...

A: Green. Mildly impressed that they got it to look so much like Ecto Cooler. All they need is to have Slimer on the bottle. 

S: Sweet, fake lime.

T: Like the appearance, straight Ecto Cooler. The taste isn’t that bad, but certainly not very beer-like. 

M: Very thin with quite a bit of carbonation.

D: Fairly drinkable given what it is, but I wouldn’t ever choose to have this again.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 05-02-2009

Miller Chill entered Canada summer of 2010, one year after the big craze of lime beers in 2009. Pours a pale light yellow colour with a big frothy white head that stays a while and creates some mild dirty lace. Big lime aroma right out of the clear bottle. Tons of bubbles stuck to the side of the glass. Watery mouthfeel making this one refreshing for hot days. The lime taste is not as strong as drinking from the bottle. Mild grain finish. Definitely a beer to drink from the bottle, as it it much better that way. Goes down easy.

355 ml (clear) bottle from LCBO.  Pours a clear bright but pale yellow gold with decent-sized lasting white head and steady bubbles.  Aroma is light sweet lime juice.  Taste is nothing particularly special but not as repulsive as I had suspected - light sweet lime juice, some lemon, salt is even detectable.  Quite thin and nothing in the finish.  It’s about as faint praise as exists, but I really think this is the best of the ’lime’ beers out there.  But as just a beer its still quite weak.
ALERT! ALERT! WARNING! CAUTION! Avoid at all costs. This beer will break your heart.
Bottled. One of the best lime beer in Macro category. That aint saying much, but one or two of these can be enjoyable during warm summer days...
Pours golden with white head, aroma is lime, some grain.  Taste is lime and salt with a sweet finish, not really much beer flavor in there.  No thanks...

12oz bottle 10/23/10 (Meijer Supermarket)-58° in Flute-Pours a crystal cleat light yellowish golden with a big loose white head. Aroma of malt and lime. Taste of the same with a bit of corn. This light bodied brew is pretty straight forward as a light lime flavored lawnmower brew. It fills the bill and better than Bud Light Lime.

I’ve had a decent amount of this stuff over the summer, and honestly, not that bad. Decent cheap light mild lawnmower "beer". Even my wife likes it! But I’ve a slight preference for the less sweet, more sour Bud Light Lime

341ml Bottle: Pours like you’d expect. Yellow. Aroma is lighter than I expected in lime, bit of corn, straw. Tastes like club soda with watery limes in it. Seriously, why is this stuff necessary? This isn’t beer.

355 ml bottle. 4%. Barriere, BC, Canada.

I’m not quite sure if the one I got was Chelada Style or plain Miller Chill (if that exists). Clear pale golden colour with tiny bubbly white head.
Malt, citrus and some mint-like in aroma.
Lemonade-like citrusy and some mild malty flavour. 
More lemon soda than beer.
Not even as good as Bud Light Lime. Not even as good as a Miller Lite with a lime in it. But better than a Bud Light.

I’m going against the grain here. Nothing pretentious here, just an honest review. Let’s review this for what it is: a light, refreshing, different tasting "beer". This isn’t a big bold beer in any sense so I’m not goint to review it as such. It actually doesn’t really taste much like beer at all. It has a nice lime flavor that reminds me of a hard 7UP. It is very refreshing and goes down very smooth. You can easily down several of these without thinking about it. While it’s obviously not on the same level as most micro offerings, it accomplishes what it set out to do. I would much rather drink this than Bud Light or Miller Lite any day. On a hot afternoon, it doesn’t get a lot better than this. Obviously, it’s not a great beer, but I don’t think it tries to be.

341 ml bottle from the LCBO
Smells like light lime water
Looks like water
Tastes like lime water
Gross
Do not drink

pale yellow.  weak fizz.  taste of strong, fake lime/lemon.  non-existent mouthfeel - tasted a bit like watered-down lime pop.  I have yet to try Bud Light Lime or Moosehead Light Lime, but a friend gave me one of these, so had to offer my take on it.
10.07.02 Pissy yellow med carb. A:Skunky lime F: This one is watery mineral. I’m a shame to say that but bud light lime is way better
weak. miller came out with another one trying to reach that niche market, but completely watery and weak.
Bottle. So I got to try this for free. That was the best thing about this "beer".

Pretty bad but it’s better than bud light lime. Atleast the lime wasn’t like an artificial punch in the face, it was subtle and I could still taste the beer, even though it was still miller lite! Good lawnmower beer I guess.

Bottle: Poured a super light yellow color lager with a small pure white bubbly head with minimal retention. Aroma of light lime notes with corn and other adjunct. Taste is also dominated by lime juice with light corn malt body. Not as bad as I had expected just quite bland with limited lime taste.
This one I tasted in a blind beer tasting and thought it was a little odd.  Tasted more like a very fruity soda than like a beer.  Lighter gold in color.

A - Lime
A - Light yellow with thin white head
T - Sour
P - Very fizzy
O - On a hot day maybe....

This is drinkable, just.  Golf tournament and this is what you get when you tell your partner that is buying the round to get me what you are having....
It’s at least better than Bud Light LIme.  Aroma of grain and a hint of lime.  Pours a pale gold with a little white head.  Taste is skunky, malty mess with a hint of lime aftertaste.
Can: Bought in Panama, long time I ve had one of these mass brews. I hope a lot of times passes before next.

Clear Bottle 355 ml LCBO 

Aroma :  fresh with hint of vitamin C , lemon soda like with a lilts sugars. 4-

Appearance: pale golden with thin light top. 2- 

Flavour and Palate: mid light bodied. Off grainy character , wet cloth , vegetable off ints with lime like flavours behind. Refreshing ? I dont think so. Chill might be good name as I need t Chill out now …

Has a spicy lime aroma which could be inviting or discouraging. Beer is bright yellow,clean, and clear in appearance. There is a mild lime taste on the palate. When this beer first came out I felt the flavor was more appealing. The lime seemed more pronounced and there was a greater hint of salty sweetness. This beer does the job on a hot day and I feel is still better than its lime competitors...should have stuck with the original recipe though.

355 ml bottle from the LCBO. AP pours clear straw with a lasting white head, laces the glass nicely AR light malt sweetness along with light lime, clean FL decent light malts with a genuine lime flavour PA over carbonation holds it back, it isnt sweet which is nice OV i liked it, one of the better lime flavoured brews

Sold simply as Miller Chill, in bottle, in Canada. Pours very plae clear macro-straw colour. Weak, foamy head, sticky lacing. Nose is milder on the lime than other lime coolers... I mean beers that I’ve had, and served to mask most of the nasty adjunct flavor. Utterly hollow and soulless, but less offensive perhaps than other Lime-flavored offerings.

Bottle.  Pours very light straw yellow with a small white head.  Not much to the aroma or flavor but for some lime and quite a bit of graininess, producing that typical macro lager skunkiness.  Not the worst thing I’ve ever had.  Sort of tasted like lime soda.

I finally broke down to try this one out of morbid curiosity. I expected some kind of disaster of the taste buds, but it seriously isn’t that bad considering style and origins. Oh don’t get me wrong, I don’t love it, but it’s not the monstrosity I anticipated.

The color isn’t that impressive, though not awful. It’s completely transparent, a straw yellow color. It does have a surprising amount of head, and even more surprising light lacing.

The aroma is typical BMC lager scent, with just a tiny hint of the obligatory salt and lime that the label tells you will be there. It’s still pretty weak by beer standards.

The flavor is actually quite limey, and that is fine considering it covers up the lame BMC pale lager flavor that I feared the most. I really must say that the extras are a welcome change to the regular mediocre macro fare. Surprisingly decent.

The feel is nothing, it’s thin and watery, and I think they wanted it that way. Still, no points here. I must say, overall it’s not a horrible summery drink. It’s light enough and just fruity enough to be thirst-quenching during the summer. They call it "Corona with the lime already included" but I’d have to say this is a step above. Not great, but certainly not awful.

A- Transparent watery pale straw yellow body and thin white head that fades rather quickly. Heavy carbonation with lots of bubbles along the side of the glass and rising to the top. Typical unimpressive light lager appearance. I was hoping for maybe some sort of eerie green glow-but it wasn’t there.

S- Heavy pale malt with hints of artificial lime-smells like a corn chip.

T-Take a bag of those Tostito’s with a hint of lime tortilla chips, puree it, and add some water and carbonation-and this product is what you get. I’m not going to even bother describing it in terms of typical beer ingredients because I can’t taste any.

P-Lots of carbonation and thin watery body.

O- Though this is an abomination to beer it really doesn’t taste bad to me. Its probably my favorite from the Miller lineup and is much better than Miller Lite. It is, however, very artificial and screams Macro Lager. I don’t buy this one myself-but my friends like it and I’ll drink a few of theirs.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 12-03-2007 17:54:11

Miller Chill--Chelada Style Light Beer with Natural Flavor--2007--4.2% ABV--10 IBU’s.?

12 oz. Green Bottle.  (3.75 / 5.0)  Fruit Beer--Light.  Thin foamy light head.  Clear thin light straw yellow color.  Mild lime citrus front.  Richer lime thin CO2 zesty soda pop citrus mild malt hidden adjunct body.  Clean refreshing lime citrus end.	  Sampled 7/7/2007.

22 oz. Bottle.  (3.75 / 5.0)  Fruit Beer--Light.  2 @ $2.49 Each.  Big foamy white mild lace head.  Clear thin yellow white color.  Zesty lime mild hop front.  Thin refreshing CO2 lime citrus body.  Clean tangy lime citrus mild hop thin refreshing soda pop end. Tangy & Tasty.  Sampled 12/10/2007.

355ml clear bottle, label does not say "chelada style", but I’m guessing this is the same beer. Light , clear, yellow coloured beer with a small, thin white head. Light nose of grain and lime and a trace of sulphur. Flavour has a small amount of lime sweetness, finishes with a dry, grainy, cereal note with some minerals. Light bodied with a lot of carbonation. A typical lime beer, consumable under hot temperatures but ultimately it’s blandness will probably make you quickly reach for something else.

Ugh, another lime beer. The aroma is musty, almost like old hops. There is corn and lime on the nose as well. The flavor has some lime, not too much and that putrid corn after taste typical from miller. All in all this might be the best douche-bag cooler I’ve had... But it still isn’t beer, or good for that.

Pours clear pale yellow. Aroma of corn filler and massproduction. Flavour is very dull yet unoffensive with a slight lime tang in the finish. It is light and refreshing. Probabaly the best of the lime beers I have had so far. But still pretty crumy.
Nice touch with the lime at the end - good with Mexican or ’spicey’ foods.  Other than that, this stuff is average light beer.
Bottle.Gold color with nice head.  Aroma, cheap beer with slight lime. Taste, cheap beer with slight lime. Not good.

Bottle.  Pours a pale golden straw color with a medium white head.  Aromas are of lime seltzer (do they make lime-flavored Alka-seltzer? Because if they do, I think it would smell like this) and weak malt.  Flavor is sweet berry/citrus...and that’s about it.  This is pretty one-dimensional, and not good.

Bottle.

A - Light golden straw color. Decent sized foamy white head that disappears fast with little to no lacing.

S - Lots of lime smell and some sweet corn lager smell.

T - Not good. The Macro lager is the base, but there is also the artificial lime taste. This artificial lime unfortunately makes the lager worse not better. Weird artificial sweet, sticky flavor that I do not like. Also a bit of salt.

M - Light body with a lot of carbonation. Kind of sticky.

D - Not good, too much of the weird artificial lime taste.

Notes: Not a fan of the lime flavor. Too sweet and off tasting. Others may like it and think it slightly improves the Macro lager, but I think it makes it worse.
Tastes like someone poured artificial lime juice into a month old bottle of MGD.

Very pale, quick-fading white head. Aroma of sharp, oxidized cardboard malts. In the flavor, the oxidation is still there, but the citric lime flavoring covers it up and complements it to the point of it not being offensive. Thin body, but zest on the palate. I could drink this if someone else was paying.

Thanks (thanks is such a fleeting word) to GregClow for this.... Appearance: Almost clear yellow with a grey head. Aroma: Like a homeless persons cardboard box blended with some ginger and lime, then pissed on by someone who ate 40 spoons of corn. Flavour: Made my head shake like a cheap bobblehead doll. Corn, chemical lime, sandpaper finish with a dash of shame.

Bottle [12oz] shared with the gang at ’WaterlooWeekend Oct.’09’ -- c/o GregClow. Pours a very pale gold with a small diminishing white head. Aroma: Ugh, diapers with lime added. Flavour’s a bit better, it’s basically a watery Shandy, dull and not for me at all. Light bodied. A waste of a bottle.

[2539-20091024] Clear bottle. Sweet candy laces and fruity lime aroma, like fizz pops. Clear, light yellow body with a quick bubbly white head. More candy laces or sweethearts in the flavour and fake fruit. Light body. Not absolutely horrid but very close; overly sweet and fruity.

(c/o GregClow, w/ him, blankboy, HogTownHarry, jerc, tupalev)

"One remembers horrors, I think, for the rest of one’s life, but memories do not always remain so sharp, and with time, and new circumstance, do not affect us so powerfully."



2009-10-29. The powerful aroma invades my nose with force, a strong character of urine, uric acid, and an unhealthy dose of urinal cakes. The mild kiss of unholy lime essence is almost unsportsmanlike in its timing. Flavour is almost a 180 degree turn. A palatable lemon-lime soda like profile, dry touch of astringency in the finish. Average to thin bodied palate with a pale yellow body. While not quite an abomination but you may still want to consider roshambo-ing anyone who gives you some, just for good measure.  Bottle shared by GregClow



"The  mix could be an abomination." Dr. Samuel Sterns, The Incredible Hulk

(bottle ( 12oz ).  shared by gregclow at October 2009 WaterlooWeekend.  Pale flat-looking yellow, wispy white head.  Smells like cheap lime candies and flyspray - only because it’s not vegetal or diaper-like (we disagree here, Paul).  Taste- papery, stale weeds and sweet cheap fake lime flavour.  Watery, slightly acidic, harsh, weakly carbonated - nothing like a beer, just a cheap stale lime cooler.

Bottle. Pours a pale gold with a small white head that disappears remarkably quickly. Aroma is initially not so pleasant, offering that stale malt and wet corn husk smell that I get from many mass produced lagers, but that slowly clears and is replaced with notes of candyish lime. Body is thin and crisp, as expected from a light lager, and the flavour holds very little that can be described as "beer-like" - it’s more reminiscent of Sprite with a very, very faint wisp of malt. As a light lime-flavoured beverage, it’s fine, but as a beer... yeah, not so much.

12 oz Bottle -- I have had this before the reformulation and can say that it is much better in its current form.  Still this beer is not that great.  Cheap lager with added lime flavors.  A little less lime than its counter part Bud Light Lime.

Summer beer, Light Refreshing. 
Already restyled once, in new bottle, getting destroyed, at least in New Jersey  by the nasty Bud Lime, not sure how long it will survive.

Pale yellow with a white cap. Stale aroma of skunk and lime. Doesn’t really taste like beer at all. More like lime and water, throw in some stale saltine crackers. Not too horrible, especially on a hot summer day at a picnic or something.

12 oz bottle.  Smells of corn, lime, and dirty socks.  Surprisingly, it retains a thin head for most of the beer.  Tastes like an extremely light lager; definite lime and salt flavor.  It’s like a Corona and lime without the skunk flavor.  I had one of these on a hot day one time after mowing the lawn and I thought it was delicious.  In other words, if you’re extremely hot, dehydrated, and thirsty, this beer goes down very well.  Any other time, stay far away from it.
Awful smell.  Fake lime flavor.  Tequiza was bad enough. Why try to emulate it?
miller chill is soda pop. miller chill is soda pop. miller chill is soda pop. miller chill is soda pop. miller chill is soda pop. miller chill is soda pop. miller chill is soda pop.
bottle into a glass- FIRST DRINK-Light and flat tasting, subtle lime and salt flavor, but bland and tasteless. HALF WAY- Leaves a bad after taste in my mouth. LAST DRINK-Gross.
A lame attempt at the Mexican market... too fruity and sweet to even consider.  Almost as bad as Bud Lime... haha.

12oz bottle. Pours golden clear with a white head. Aroma is of dusty malt, lime, salt, and urine. Taste is of dusty malt, fake lime, and salt. Mouthfeel is very carbonated and salty. This is the worst idea ever. It wasn’t even remotely drinkable. I see no purpose for me to ever drink this beer again.

Got this free when I bought a slab of Coopers about a year ago, wow, thanks... Nose hair curling aroma of utterly fake lime. Taste is like one of those powdered lime flavoured stomach remedies that you mix with water, which is atrocious enough, but made even more gag inducing by the presence of a tablespoon or two of salt. Fake lime and salt finish that lasted for ages and made me retch. Drank half, then turfed the rest and washed my mouth out, then cracked a lovely Coopers to kill the rest of the foul taste that the water couldn’t get rid of. Fucking disgusting stuff, literal drainpour.
From the Bottle at a ber in Turners Falls MA. Fruity aroma. Clear golden coloured hoppy and fruity with a lime flavoured finish.  The best beer that comes in a clear bottle.

Bottle: pint glass: pours a clear, pale yellow corn, high pour bubbles leaving thin layer of head.  the nose is miller + skunk+ pee+ metal = argh.  Didn’t expect much though.  The taste isn’t so great, a poorly flavored Miller... although maybe this would pair well with some spicy fish tacos!  Not likely.

I’m not going to take this beer too seriously. It is what it is. It’s widely available in my area so I run into it often. 

Poured from a bottle.

Pale yellow color. Plenty of carbonation bubbles but no head at all. 

Smell is a bit skunky with a hint of citrus.

Taste is not as bad as some would have you believe. It’s basicaly miller lite with a lime squeezed in it. A mild salty flavour sneaks in at the back end.

The mouthfeel is much like sparkling water. Not to offensive.

Overall I can drink this beer. I enjoy sipping well made beers and I enjoy pounding BMC beers. I can pound these all night. Like I said don’t drink this beer thinking it’s going to blow you away.
fake lime taste...slight fake salt taste. overall a crappy beer. THe only advantage is that you dont have to carry around a lime...id rather carry around the lime personally.
Bottle 35,5 cl. Clear yellow with a dense white head. Lightly tart lemony nose. Light body, notes of sulphur and lime with a dry, quinine-like finish. 060709
12 oz. bottle, free promotion at Sully’s in downtown Cincinnati.  Uneven lime and light beer; feels like it was just mixed and has begun to separate.

From the Bottle at the GABF, Colorado Convention Center 13/10/2007
Fruity aroma. Clear golden coloured hoppy and fruity with a lime flavoured finish.

Overall Impression: 
Not much to say here, it’s crappy beer: Now with Lime! and Salt!  and it’s still crappy!

Pours a yellow/green with little head.  Okay, on a warm/hot day, pouring this into a nice glass and such, not a bad beer.  I will say I give this a slight better score than Bud Light Lime.  To me not quite as "light" and flat as BLL.  No, this is not for sitting by the fire, hell it’s beer for golfing, going to beach, pool, BBQs at a neighbor’s, etc.  It is what it is, and for that I give it a bit abover average rating.  I enjoy them, especially if they are cold and free.  No need to cellar these babies!
Pours a very pale yellow with a 1 finger foamy white head and high effervescence. Aroma is lime and corn. Flavor is lime and mineral. This is a crappy beer.
Arent you the same company that passed a "man law" of no fruit in beer?  How bout a chick law of no salt in beer either.
Bad beer, with bad attempt to offset the shady flavors by throwing some lime juice in. It doesn’t work, epic fail!

12oz bottle that my sisters boyfriend brought to my house. Pours a yellow pale color with a small whit ehead. Nose is light lime syrup with a hint of corn. palate is thin and fizzy. Flavor is lime syrup with a bit of grass.

Tasted like soda.  Didn’t really taste like beer at all but I was suprised that I didn’t want to spit it out.  If you want beer, this is not it, but if you want a beverage that isn’t like anythign else, here is your choice.

Had to steal a sip from one of my friends who claim this beer was good.  Disgusting!!!  It was salty and bitter.  How can anyone think this beer is good? can’t really give you my normal aroma and color cause I drank it out of this lime green bottle ad really had no desire to smell it.
This beer is awful.  It takes like fruit loops.  But the problem is I like fruit loops cause they are fruit loops, and not a beer.
Did someone accidentally drop the salt shaker into the batch? A little too bold for my taste.

bottle. Poured very pale clear yellow with thin white head. Smells like a lime margarita. Moderate carbonation, light mouthfeel. Crisp and refreshing, malty flavour with subtle citrus aftertaste. I’d drink this anyday before a corona with a lime jammed down the neck.

This brew has an aroma of salt with a hint of lime and is light gold and clear in appeance. Pours foamy head that dissolves fairly quickly. Tastes like you would expect it to: a slightly sweet pale lager infused with lime and salt. Drinks smoothly and with little to no afterbite. Overall, not bad for a macro, and it is quite refreshing on a hot summer day but not for the hardcore beer afficionado.
Did not like the after taste.  Better drink up cause I do not think this one will be around much longer

Nose of traditional American Style Lager hops with a hint of citrus.  Pours a sparkling pale straw.  The chaste white frothy head is rocky with very good lace.  The brew is pretty neutral but slightly sweet with low acidity and a heavy citrus finish.  The light watery body is fizzy.  Reminds me of Zima.  Great for warm weather fun, but not for the serious connoisseur.

2009 Bottle - Pours lighter than a normal Miller, with a small white head...aroma is phoney baloney lime syrup, thats it...so much fucken lime in the nose, absolutely nothing else is noticable (intentional...)...flavour is like lime seltzer water...salt??? are you fucking kidding me? salt in the beer? did I get a nuance of salt?...my excuse of being obsessive compulsive is only going to work so long while getting these easy ticks...at some point, it’s just masochism...

***Disclaimer***

I was drunk at my girlfriends house, and this was the only "beer" she had left to drink.

With that said, this was just nasty. Aroma of corn, fungus, and a sweaty jock strap. Flavor was cloying and disgusting lime, and more corn. Ugh. Just two questions: Why was this beer made? and what is the justification for charging MORE for a sixxer than a comparable light beer?
Dont care much for it. The idea of it takes away from the extra effort you would have to take in putting a lime wedge in your Corona. Nice try, it just aint for me.

355ml bottle. Pale and opaque with a large head of loose bubbles that quickly dissolved into nothing. Highly carbonated with a zesty fruit and lemonade aroma. Soft drink like in the mouth. Might be okay on a very hot day.
Carbonated water with lime. Piss color with fizzy head. Not slamable. Too much lime in a bad way.
Too sweet. Too watery. Too much like lime seltzer water. But at least the macro’s are exploring new flavors.
glow in the dark beer?? little better than BL Lime, but still needs work...
A hint of lime?  Hmm, well the lime is present in the beer, but so is the regular taste of Miller...so I guess the lime does a good job here!
Wanna be Bud light lime and that’s not even good. Lot of hype when it first came out. But just sucks.

Bottle. Poured a very light yellow. Aroma was of corn and lime. Taste was similar. Slight corn like flavor with an overpowering salty lime finish. Prefer this to Bud Lime...but that’s not saying much.

Super pale yellow pour, almost looks like a light cider. Small white head. I can’t pinpoint the aroma, light and somewhat sweet. Flavor of lime and pale malts. It has it’s place and time but nothing I’m looking for.

Had this for the first and last time two summers ago. Good lord this is terrible. I think someone was making a margarita, and realized they had no tequila. So instead, a can of Miller Lite was poured in.

I actually like this beer a lot...but I have to be in the mood for it. It’s perfect for sitting on the porch on a hot summer day, other than that, keep it in the fridge. Decent lime aroma. Kinda watery lime and salt flavoring that is quite refreshing. Extremely drinkable.

Bottle.  Lime is evident in the aroma.  Usual pale lager color, small white head.   Taste is obviously flavored, and they went overboard with it at that.  Not altogether unrefreshing, if you first disabuse yourself of any notions of beer.
The lime is very overpowering and sweet. If you take your time and it warms alittle its shocking!

Weird stuff. Calling this "beer" is a stretch. I’d put it in the Smirnoff Ice category.  Often skunked due to green bottle.  Pale yellow color with a white head.  Aroma is limey and artificial.  Flavor is adjunk, chemicals, lime, and salt.  I actually think it’s a little better than most of the Miller crap however.
Missing a lot in taste, look, and smell.  Tries to do something that maybe beer should not do.  All flavors and aromas are extremely artificial-like.

Weak and watery pour with heavy carbonation. Lime and salt overpower any malt or hops that might be hiding in there somewhere. Yes, it is probably more of a wine cooler than a beer, but I don’t hate it as much as others. Goes great with Mexican food, chips and salsa, etc. Prefer Miller Chill slightly over Bud Light Lime, probably due to the hint of salt.
This poured a very lgiht straw yellow with a white head. Aroma was lime and bubble gum. Flavor was citrusy, salty, bubble gum, a sweet mess really
Very pale yellow with a tight white finger of foam.  Aroma is all lime.  Fizzy body, tastes like the rim of a margarita glass.  All lime, salt, and simple syrup.

Rating no. 1900.  Green-glassed and long-necked.  Very lightly-skunked opening salvo swallowed up by lime cleanser and exotic must (mango, guava).  Very faint pale malt.  Very pale yellow pour with a relatively noisy off-white head.  Tastes a tad vomity, but not in the good way, with bland lime and light lemon trails, essentially seltzer water a splash of grain, no alcohol or malt or otherwise "beery" qualities. Extremely overcarbonated medium body.  Sweet but not cloying.  This isn’t  offensive or even terribly childish (indeed I’d certainly have it over most other BMC), but it’s more akin to some sort of soda than beer and the rating shows it.
Bottle.  Pours a yellow pale body with a white head.  A lightly sweet body with a hint of lime.  Salty finish with a thin mouthfeel.
12oz bottle that I regret buying.  Was this really needed after tequiza. If I want lime or salt in my beer I now prefer to add it myself.  Very bad.
Horrible beer, the lime taste left a horrible after taste and hints of too much salt made this beer almost unbearable

22 oz pint bottle from gas city.  clear pale pale yellow, white fluffy head, minor lacing. unappealing.  aroma is some kind of weak limeness or lemonness.  hard to tell.  flavor is all wealk limeyness, no hint of beer.  watery mouth feel, weird sweet finish.  really pretty bad stuff.  if you want lime, push a lime wedge in a bottle of beer.
Cheap cheap beer.  Corn and lime.  I would probably rather drink this than the piss that is a normal miller.......

Pale lager pour with typical aroma, plus a hint of citrus, piss, and malt.  The taste is mediocre - watery lite beer with a splash of Diet Sprite soda - mildly tart, with a hint of spice.  The packaging is dishonest - this is not a chelada.  What else can one expect from Miller?
I like almost al beers.....not undrinkable. just not good......and its not as sweet as bud lite lime. corn, lime, sweets and well thats about it..

Eeek, I think when this stuff came out I had a taste and thought if they dropped the lime and salt that they might be on to something halfway drinkable, I had a bit of it this weekend and I don’t know it has been reformulated since then or what but it lacked any hop character or dryness at all. The stuff was smooth, and no boys and girls that is not a good thing. The lime flavor was way overpowering and tasted very artificial. The salt was a little out of control too; basically it left it with a chemical lime soda taste that I really did not like.

Miller in a green bottle… why?  I’ve put off trying this one for quite some time, but today was my lucky day to finally crack one open.  My oh my, I hate the beer more than the beer ads for it.  Straw yellow with a large white fading head.  Aroma of mild lime, apple and funk.  Taste of apple, malt, corn.  Astringent as all get out and pretty bad but actually exceeded my zero expectations

~Pours a pale clear yellow with quickly disappearing white head.
~Lemon lime scent with sour wheat.
~Sweet sugary lime taste with hints wheat.
~Light feel, quick sweet finish.
~Not very good.
Bottle.  Wow...how terrible.  I can’t believe that anyone thought this was a good idea.
Bottle.  Pours gold.  Smells of some malt. Mostly lime.  Tastes sticky with the lime, but some malts present.  A little to sticky flavor and aftertaste.  I wont be drinking this one again.

Bottled. A golden beer with a thin white head. The aroma is sweet with lime like notes of sodapop combined with notes of guave fruit. The flavor is sweet with notes of guave and lime - like a sodapop. The body is thin.

Had a sample at NABA ’06.  Pours a mellow golden yellow color.  Aromas of grains, light hops, and a funky musty smell.  Flavor is bland with a weird funk, salty lime.  This stuff is nasty.  I think if you did the dog thing and licked your own junk after a basketball game it would taste better than Miller Chill.
This is a cool looking beer and a great gimic when it came out, but that is about it.  I don’t like the lime and salt and the smell is not appeasing to anyone.

Junk, lime and salt taste very artificial !  come on if you like lime and salt with or in your beer, the real thing is not hard to get.
And will taste much better!

Quite pale yellow pour with little head, not a pretty beer.  The aroma is atrocious, but the flavor is not as awful.  Mostly lime with just a hint of salt.  It delivers what it advertises, at least, and my girlfriend loves it.

This ones funny. It tastes like premium light beer with 100% natural lime flavor. Oh wait, I mean it tastes like a Mexican inspired recipe with lime and salt, you know, Chelada style.

Sample beer from the Union. Free is good.
The only reason I bought this was to get free Bucs tickets from the miller light girls.  This is like drinking margarita mix.  Just plain gross.
Woah. That’s the best way to describe this: rank, skunky, sulfur. It’s all here. Watery and fizzy mouthfeel also. Wouldn’t drink unless it was free.

Well, I started reviewing beer because i feel that as a hardened Aussie drinker it’s my duty to point out little gems that my fellow might also enjoy. However, it has just dawned on me that it’s equally my duty to warn them of absolute shockers and abominations that I am unfortunate enough to  encounter. This pathetic excuse for a brew fits into both of those descriptive categories. It’s colouration...well let’s just say it gives a very accurate indication of it’s taste! The only reason it even managed a one is on account of some of the rank Chilli beers I’ve tasted!
Poured from a 12oz bottle a light ye4llow with a very little white head. Aroma was a smeely sock. Flavor had a lemon lime flavor.

Single bottle in Miami. Almost no head. Looks like a bubbly glass of ginger ale. Not much scent. Very watery. Lasting lime. Lower salt level than Sol version. Light lingering lime flavour. Kiind of rough as it warms. 1 bottle is plent.

I just like the thought of chilling.  That is why i had this beer, and it was at no cost.   Tried to elevate myself into a different zone when experiencing this but to no avail.  Was fun though and beat bud light lime by far.  Try the chill!!

Sampled a bottle on a scorching summer day, and it did deliver some refreshment. Pale yellow in color with a diminishing head and a few spots of lacing. Faint mild malt aroma with lots of lemon & lime. Watery, fizzy mouth feel that provides a tickling sensation. Finishes empty and clean. The lime is strong in the taste, and there isn’t much behind it. Pale lager/adjunct aspect is still there. Very thin and watery, this is indeed a summer pounder if you can stomach the heavy fizzy affect. Comparable to Zima in flavor and feel, it was quenching. One and done for this guy.
A big "0" Sulfur, Skunk, Smell Virtually none,Watery, salty,Head - Initial appearance none
Not one of my favorites. somewhat refreashing but basically its millers style of a corona.
Not as bad as people say. Is a refreshing alternative to just regular old beer. Has a fresh taste and the proper hints of salt and lime. Great for BBQs or Pool parties.

Don’t know if it’s because  the bottle had been sitting in my fridge for a few months but the smell was pretty bad when first poured, but got a little better as the carbonation wore off. Kind of like a urine with lime smell. Very plae color with light carbonation. had two distinct tastes, one was a light beer flavor and one was a lime jucie tatse. Flavors didn’t blend at all, just compeated. Not bad, but not that great

The color was a pale yellow, with carbonation bubbles
the nose was yeasty, lime, and corn
 The Taste has a hint of lime, and salt.
It is okay beer to drink for a football game..
Refreshing. Better that I thought it would be. Cheap Would buy again. not badat all. good sumer brew.
Miller chill is an absolutely horrible beer.  It tastes like Miller Lite with a hint of salt and lime.  I would be shocked if this beer isn’t discontinued soon.

Typical swill appearance with an unusually large, dish soap foam head; significant lacing when drunk quickly enough.  Aroma of swill beer plus fake lime.  Flavor exactly the same, but heavier on fake lime than the aroma is.  Light, bubbly, fizzy mouthfeel.  I’d rather take a Natty Light and squeeze in a wedge of lime by a longshot; at least then the lime would be real; plus, it would be half as expensive.

From a  12 fl. oz. bottle coded: 05268 D40532.  Pours an almost greenish-yellow.  Sparkling carbonation and fizzy white head that sticks around longer than expected.  Corny aroma with lime.  Every thing is pretty average up the point that I take my first sip. 

 Phaww!  Not so good.  Watered down with metalic hops, lime and overripe fruit is my best estimation. Closer to a real cheap cider.  Nope, not again for me.

Pours a clear golden color.  Aroma is boring and plain with a little lime to it. The flavor is the same way.  Not as good as Bud Light Lime.

12 oz. bottle.
Bottle @ Karl’s. Nose of lime and corn.  Rose’s lime juice and corn syrup left in a jar to ferment out for about a week then refrigerated.

This was the only beer at the hotel bar that I haven’t rated, so I had no choice. I took one for the team. Pours a clear golden with a medium white head. The aroma is mostly lime and a sweet malt. The taste is basically a ton of artificial lime with the basic sweet skunky malt.

Voila...finally the Miller Brewing Company has upgraded from its usual "piss" beer. 

Introducing Miller Chill - "piss with a hint of lime and salt." 

What, so they took a their miller lite recipe and threw in a few limes and a ’pinch’ of salt?

I have only had this at a local mexican restaurant with real authentic recipe mexican.   With the food, I think it’s pretty good.   I have not tried it with anything else, but it makes a nice match to chips & hot salsa.

22 oz green bottle from local grocery store. Skunk and corn smell over some lime citrus aroma. Clear very light straw color with copious bubbles and a rocky white head. Artificial lime flavor and sweet soapy finish with a touch of some kind of bitterness.

For Americas Take on a Mexican Beer with a Hint of Lime its not to bad! Drinkable with food or a day at the beach! Kind of too strong with the lime taste but none the less I would grab one if they were in a friends fridge or kicking it at the beach!
It tastes like I took a Miller High Life or Miller Lite and squeezed some lime into it. That’s it.

This was interesting.  It definitely hit the "chelada style," but it was too sweet for my taste.  By the end it almost tasted syrupy.  I think that this would have been better if they had not added lime flavor, and let you add as much lime as you wanted.
I found this in the fridge of a rental condo.  Should have left it alone.  Clear vile tasting.  No head, no flavor.  Gag.

tried it its ok but if you had to drink anything like this to refresh yourself...try a thing called a vodka tonic. way better. and more kick. this is definately a chick drink...oir  i guess a faggot drink.

Taste like a different type of Hawaiian Punch.  It’s aroma smells like a wine cooler.  It’s appearance was brought to 1 when it came in an aluminum bottle.  It’s flavor is nice, but hardly beer.  More like Hawaiian Punch.  It’s smooth, but not beer.

no. no. no. this shit is just wrong. first of all what the hell is chelada-style? chelada is just a slang word for beer in mexico. aside from stupid naming this crap tastes like sprite mixed with high life. but this is low life. Jodete Miller.

I had to try it, I mean it is all green and says CHILL right on it, and nothing goes better when CHILLIN’ THAN CHILL.  Or something like that.  Anyway I did not find this beverage to be completely repulsive, I would drink this before a Miller Light any day of the week.  Had a citric, fruit juicy flavor.  Definitely artificial fruit flavoring taste with no real crisp limeness.  Smells like a miller light with lime juice from the green plastic lime in someone’s fridge dripped in to it.  Has an odd sweetness in the finish and a cough  mediciney after taste.  Weird.  T

This beer has absolutely nothing good to offer.  It is designed to compete with the Corona + lime.... but it tastes absolutely nothing like it.  It is very salty tasting which is awful for the palate. Definitely worth drinking if you’re on a quest for something awful

20 something oz bottle from some shitty beer store in Freehold. WOW was this shit bad. I mean real bad not that well it sort of sucked type of bad that you giv a beer when you don’t enjoy it but BAD like I might never drink a ber ever again after this BAD. I used to drink this horrible orange flavored miimosa Andre champagne in college when I was pregaming for the night before I would go out and this really brought me back to those broke adolescent times. Nothing that is called a beer should ever resembel this and God help the jerkoff that green lighted this project because I’m sure he has his own personal circle reserved in hell for making this abomination against man and beast.
Well it’s better than a wine cooler. Beats Bud Light Lime. If you go this rout get a corona and slice of lime.

A gift from Dalekliz, glad I didn’t have to spend my own money on this one.  Pours like urine with a white foamy head.  My girlfriend’s two cents its like a mike’s hard lemonade it ain’t beer.  Salty nasty nose.  Taste is yucky blech.
Why is this called beer?  I drink beer for the flavor--this had none!  Mike’s hard lemonade is better than this.  Will not drink again.
one of the worst beers i’ve ever had...carbonated water with lime, terrible flavor...but it was free, so i drink it

Well I finally tried this stuff.  Light beer with carbonation and some sort of flavoring? Really tasteless.  I even put a lime in just to give me something to taste!  Had this on a hot day so kind of like water but I would rather have the water.  Eh just no flavor.
Light in color, with a subtle lime flavor.  A good beer on a hot summer day.  Refreshing for a change of pace.
Aroma was just a lite beer with lime added.  I liked this beer.  It was easy to drink on a hot summer day.  Near the same as Corona with a slice of lime.
Great looking beer, no nose and virtually no taste except  for a lime syrupy flavor.  This was exactly what i was expecting.  Looked like beer tasted like limeaid.
This stuff is nasty, I had to dump the rest of it, it just taste like lime and that is it... no good! dont bother
I have never been a fan of Miller to begin with and Miller Chill is just another reason why.

I have no idea what posessed miller to try and copy Mexican culture. The bottom line is... Mexican beer sucks, don’t try and be like that, make a quality product! Then again, it’s miller. Oh well, I still give this about ten mugs  down.

In a straight comparison to BL Lime, it is better, but this means very little.  The lime is not as overpowering in Chill, and it is not terrible to drink on a hot summer day.  Also, there is a hint of salt in this that is not present in BL Lime.  Would not make a habit of drinking this.
Bottle. Pours goden with white head. Aroma is lime and grass. Its miller lite and lime. Enjoyed it even though it is a poore beer you could do a lot worse.

Just a horrible beer, if this was any attempt in countering AB’s BL Lime it failed misurably,  obviously it’s a another attempt to move in on Corona, but it’s worse than BL Lime, no flavor whatsoever, watery and bland, I got absoutely no flavor of any kind from this, rank this right up there with Tequiza, this beer was absoutely disgusting, Miller should be ashamed of itself
Your piss water now comes with LIME! Same shitty taste now with lime.... Terrible.
Bottle from Neighbors house. Someone below hit it right on the head and it wasn’t the moron who had 31 ratings and gave it a 4.4. This beer reminds me of Tequiza only worse.

This is probably the highest I have ever rated a Miller brew. Before I start to describe a chelada, the tangyness actually comprimises pretty decently with the brew. Sometimes it can be a litte flat. Anyway, if you’re ever in central mexico and you’re looking for a chelada, dont be suprised to find a big huge glass of beer in front of you with a few lemons and loaded full of spicey, peppery seasoning. It’s very tastey. But after a few you find yourself pretty loaded. And the next morning your gut is aching from all the seasonings and spices. Very rich and full, try to make one yourself, but dont forget to load it up with spice. :)
Should be called Miller Crack. This beer is great. I really enjoyed the lime flavor. I drank it from a bottle.

Tasted against BL Lime at a BBW.  Smells like corn, but didn’t pick up any lime characteristics in the nose.  Lime somewhat comes through in the flavor but on the whole, this is pretty nasty.  Thin mouthfeel but prickly carbonation. Wouldn’t drink again unless I had to.

I remember Tequiza from back in the day - sweet, citrusy........a good drunk drink.  This was like that but worse - gross smelling, bad tasting with a hint of lime.  The people who enjoy this occupy a different world than mine.

22 ounce bomber purchased at the local Circle K here in Davis, CA.  Wow, this aroma is...just wrong.  Smells like the vomit of someone who had a bad batch of guacamole the night before.  Vegetal, sour, lime aroma.  Rotting vegetables.  Fermented diapers.  Pale transparent yellow color with a white bubbly head that is quickly dissipating.  Sweet, overcarbonated lime flavors up front...tastes like 7-up followed by corny graininess.  That’s it.  Highly carbonated and acidic.  Probably better than drinking plain Miller.
I believe they were going after a mexican audience and getting a good alternative to margarita with the hint of salt, but its pretty much just gross.

12 ounce bottle. Shaker glass. Pale golden with a thin head. Aroma - grain and a hint of lime. As advertised the flavor was dominated by lime and salt in a pale lager. Maybe slightly better than High Life or MGD, but still lags behind Corona with a healthy dose of lime added.
This just isn’t good. Not a lot of lime in the aroma, but it’s there in the flavor, and it’s seems artificial. Just not something I’d drink again.

This beer was forced on me and I don’t turn down free beer. (not that much of a beer snob yet)   I was in a hot little house visiting my folks in SC and found this beer to be quite refreshing.  I’d drink one of these any time (when it’s free).
This beer tastes good, but the salt and lime is overpowering and one can’t drink more than one or two at a time.

Pours a pale golden color with a quickly discipitating white head.  Subtle sweet malt aromas with hints of dusty citrus.  Light bodied with good carbonation.  Malty taste which quickly gives way to a citrusy, salty flavor with a gentle hop finish.  Although I am not a big fan of premixed lime and beer, I discovered Miller Chill is perfect  for an excellent Tex-Mex Michelada (beer, Clamato, lime juice, pepper, salt, worstershire sauce, and tabasco).  Try with nachos and salsa, or a citrusy avocado salad.
12 oz. bottle.  Pours a pale golden yellow.  Flavor:  Hints of lime and salt.  Not awful, but not good either.  Bud Light Lime is better, IMHO.

When do I learn that buying bad beer as a joke, always turns out to be a joke on myself? 
Pours a slightly hazy yellow with a small frothy white head and a bit of random lacings... Not the good kind. Somewhat sweet with a light citric acidity and a bit of bitterness. Some malty aromas with some EXTREMELY artificial lime aromas. Short bitter finish with more lime. A bit like a mix of bad beer and a lime soda.
what a thirst quencher. much more convenient than having to cut up a lime and put it into the bottle. and its a light beer to boot! will purchase this beer again.

....Poured a crap yellow. Tasted like watered down crap beer with an artificial lime taste and barely a palate. Not much to type here except.....what do you expect, its Miller...A beer company that spends millions on ad campaigns saying how good their beer is when infact is horrible.....
one of the best beers I have tried to date and I am by no means a fan of Miller but they got this one right great beer for that hot summer day!
This beer reminded me of a powerade flavor I used to love. I forget which flavor, but not lemon or lime. Clear gold pour, lime on the nose. I actually didnt completely hate it, but it is what it is
Wow, this beer is not good.  I’m drinking this with a group of people and that is the general consensus.  It tastes like a bad beer that someone added some lime flavored candy to.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours light yellow with little, to no head.  Smells like dough, sweat, solvent, puke, and a splash of lime.  The smell alone should’ve been a deterrent.  Probably better not to pour out of bottle and sniff.  Initial flavor was sweet with a salty finish and lime throughout.

12oz bottle.   Well, a generous gift from a friend last night.   I’ve wanted to try this for awhile, but never had the courage to fork over cash for it.   And I’ll say that while it isn’t good, its better than miller lite by a good margin, but then I guess adding any flavoring to the black hole of flavor that is miller lite would improve it, and I happen to like lime in general.   Clear pale yellow with a wispy, weak head.   Corny sweetness, wet grain, and light lime in the aroma.   Not as much lime as I expected.   The flavor is a lot of sweet corn as well, with more sweaty off flavors than miller lite, but maybe that is the byproduct of the lime flavor, which covers the rest up but remains somewhat subtle.   I was honestly expecting a lot more lime, and I think that for what this is, it’s reasonably well done.   You can pretty much get the same effect with a wedge of lime in your beer, but if you’re really lazy, this could hit the spot on a hot day.

In my continuing adventures with crap beers, the party I was at also (in addition to the Bud Light Lime I just rated) featured this turd.  The BLL was clearly the superior turd brew.  This beer was clear gold with virtually no head.  Just a thin white fizzy head that evaporated into the evening sky.  The aroma was an offputting mix of sour, corn and salt.  The flavor is ruined by the salt.  Why the hell anyone thinks putting salt into a beer is a good idea is an idiot.

The taste is not bad but is watery with a highly carbonated bite at the end. I had one of these first on a hot day in August and had about 3 before the feeling subsided. I tried to give it another shot and still feel the same.
This stuff is garbage taste like artifical lime in miller lite digusting. No head drink corona instead. Avoid it like the plague
pours light gold, smells like im about to eat nacho chips, goes down very easy and smooth.
Pretty gross.  At least with Corona you need to get off your lazy ass to add the lime.
Pours light gold with very thin head.  Nose of  lime flavored tortilla chips.  Flavor is lime and corn.  No aftertaste.  Very, very easy to drink.
Bottle.  Pours light gold.  Smell of salt and lime.  Taste like Miller Lite with some artificial lime and salt added.  Pretty harmless.
12oz bottle: pours golden brown with quick fading head, aroma has slight hint of lime, flavor light on malt with hint of lime not very complex way over priced, safe to say i will never buy again.

Good head,rapid carbonation,gold beer.Aroma lime,lemon.Flavour fresh pewk,talk about regurgitator.Alright lets be serious,lime lemon pewk,finish bitter pewk,KRAP missar mirrer,now I remember what a good spew tastes like.
Ok this beer is bad, but for some reason I can drink it.  I taste the lime, but not so much the salt.  Weird for sure.

12 oz bottle.  Very pale straw/white wine colour.  Thin white head.  Aroma is of lemon-lime that really reminds me of 7-Up.  Light straw-like malts on the back.  Low bitterness.  It really does taste like soda... I just need some rye for a decent highball.  Surprisingly drinkable.

Bottle.  Pours a light golden yellow with a decent white and active head.  Aroma and Taste is of salt and lime.  Reminds me of Miller LIte, but much better.  Pretty good whether it is cool or warm.  Not bad to have during a hot summer day.  Overall, this is a pretty good beer when it is on sale, as it is easy to drink and fairly tasty.
Looks like a miller lite, smells like a miller lite with lime, tastes like a miller lite and sprite.
This basically tastes like a Miller Lite with a squeeze of lime and a lot of salt... I’ll pass
Smooth refreshing beer, decent aroma, great taste of lime and salt. A light beer with a light price

Bottle 1/2 finger white head.  Aroma is next to not existent.  Almost looks like water, very pale in color.  Taste is totally lacking.  At least with Corona you have that corn aroma/texture.   The only advantage to this beer it that it does not smell like skunk.

I consider this to be a "mass market beer" and coming from miller, i half expected it to taste as such. It kind of reminded me of lime soda as opposed to a traditional "chelada" style cervaza. Great party beer
Fairly refreshing and I like the taste.  It finishes cleanly and goes down rather easily.  They conjure up images of warmer weather in more summery locales.  Definitely an all day drinker!

From the good folks at Bon Vivant who bet me I hadn’t had this before. They were right! Pour a clear straw yellow. Small fizzy white head. Nose is salt and lime. Taste is just like those Tostitos with a hint of lime. Basically that plus a Miller Lite mixed is the best description. Not terribly offensive, taste-wise. Body is very light and fizzy. Ends with more lime and salt dominating the Miller Lite. Would go well with corn chips and salsa or Mexican food. Maybe even at the beach or after mowing the lawn.
Sweet taste but really this sux. Light beer with that lime flavor that really makes me sick.  Corn is another overwhelming flavour which shouldn’t really be in a beer.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a clear pale yellow color with a large white head.  The aroma is funky sweet lime and corn.  The flavor is a heavy dose of lime with a corn malt foundation.  This was purchased for me a s a joke so I figured I would rate it.
This has no smell, huge head, horrible lacing. Piss color like miller lite. The taste is sweet. Its a hint of lime. Better then miller lite...but still sucks.

What the hell is cheleda anyway? Food in your beer? Are we in Mexico or the united states? Obviously, I am not in the target demographic (Fat, proud, messican chick) for this product. Color is light neon green, like ghostbuster’s slime. No SAB, this is not appealing. Smells like weak limeaide and poor american pale lager mixed together. Tastes like salted watery pale american lager with watered down limeaide ledtover from sonic. Finishes like water beer. Might be better than Miller Lite since the lime does taste better than the corn they use to make Miller Lite with.
Well what can you say? It’s a beer that tastes like lime. Not a beer taste at all but a fruity limey drink for chicks. I’ll admit I had one. Not what I’m looking for out of a beer.

I was given a bottle of this and told it was just like Corona. Ouch, what an insult to Corona!

The appearance and smell was that of generally most American macro lagers--pale yellow and sour smelling. There was supposed to be a hint of lime but I couldn’t tell in the smell.

The taste was more of the same: sour sour sour. I could hard swallow it.

It was sour and bitter and I wouldn’t recommend it to anyone. If you want a Mexican-style beer, get a Mexican beer!

The last time I had something with the word "Chelada" on the bottle, I almost fuckin’ puked. And I’m no primadonna when it comes to sampling disgusting fuckin’ brews. So I was pleasantly surprised to find that this is a harmless combination of cheap American Lager with hints of salt and lime; Also known as Tequiza circa 1998. In other words it’s exactly what it claims to be. Not that that makes it great necessarily, just marginally better than anticipated since I was fearing the worst after discovering that word Chelada after getting home and there being no turning back...

These are good ice cold on a hot summer day...otherwise I wouldn’t touch them.
