I think Miller did this pretty well...the salt and the lime are a good flavor with the beer.  Unfortunately, if it’s beer you’re looking for, this won’t suffice.  It is what it is.
Ugh, this stuff is nasty. I must have gotten a hold of an expired batch or soemthing, because this stuff tasted really skunky-funky. I just wanted this beer to be over, I didn’t enjoy it at all.

Pale straw color with minimal foam ring and spots.

Smells kinda like vomit.  As it warms it smells like someone squeezed a lime wedge over the vomit.

Tingly carbonation and light-medium mouthfeel offers up that sparkling grape juice quality.

Sweet light malt almost completely covered by the lime flavor and some grapiness.  Weird watery Zima-like taste on the finish.  Tastes like a really light beer with some lime juice and sweetener added.
Bottle.  So I have decided to start rating the cheaper more mass produced brews.  Like a miller lite with some fake candy lime flavors.  I hate to say it though it was pretty easy to drink the stuff.

An acquaintance recommended I try this beer when she saw I was drinking Corona Extra with a lime.  I was skeptical, and after the first few sips, it was palatable.  Better than I expected, but I didn’t expect much.

This is nothing like a chelada. Think pelligrino, plus lime, plus some sort of artificial fruit, plus a load of fizz. Yellow body white head. Maybe some grapes in the taste. Semi-Refreshing due to the watery nature but definitly not a tasty one.

White fizzy head with a clear yellow body. Lime and grass in the aroma. Light lime and fizzy corn taste. Not a beer. Bottle says that this grassy soda has a 110 calories, not pleasent to drink at all.

This is perhaps worse than Olympia or OE.  Let me walk you through my tasting process:  Cacheesh - sip - WTF? - It’s salty - I taste fake citrus - oh, okay, I am drinking the sweat of a circus clown.  That’s it.  It taste sweaty.  This should be in the worst 50 Beers list.  Chelada?  More like Checaca!
Worst beer I’ve ever put in my mouth.  However, I have heard guys talking about how it’s good...  Beats me...
Tried it at summerfest in milwaukee.  Not that bad.  Its refreshing.  Basically a miller lite with some fruit and salt in it.
just an attempt to take some corona fans away from them and go to miller.  nothing special, just a lime version of their normal crap.
Great summer beer. The lime flavor taste natural not like candy or cleaner. My favorite summertime out on the deck beer.
Pale yellow color without much aroma. It tasted like Sprite mixed with weak beer. This might be OK on a hot summer day.

The first time I tried this I really enjoyed it - but only because I had several white Russians beforehand so anything tasted (and looked) good.  I love things with lime and salt but mixed with miller....yucky.  Of course, if it were a hot summer day on a golf course, chill wouldn’t be too bad.
Missing a lot in taste, look, and smell.  Tries to do something that maybe beer should not do.  All flavors and aromas are extremely artificial-like. Barely drinkable.

Lime sherbet nose.  Pale yellow straw, decent head that dissipates quickly.  Very mild sweetness and hops, the lime sourness dominates.  Given the right circumstances (e.g. food or really hot weather), this would be a decent choice.  A bit strange, but it really isn’t too bad.

Why would anyone in their right mind brew a beer inspired by a mexican recipe? Mexican beer sucks and this beer is almost as bad. This is Miller trying to make a buck, make cheap ass beer and throw some lime and salt in it and sell it for a premium price. This beer is so watered down that its sad to think that Americans really like this garbage!!!

I am a fan of mexican beers. they are refeshing and easy to drink. this beer is aweful. the first sip you kinda think its ok. once you finish half the bottle  its bitter and makes you wanna drink natural ice to wash the taste out. To give you the true taste its like sprite and beer mixed.
This beer, right?   Not impressed at all.  I’ll take a corona or land shark (with a real lime, thanks)  Not good.   Not good at all.

Aroma is ok, I get a hint of lime.  However, the aftertaste of this is just abysmal.  It reminds me of a hint of vomit and limey salt, kind of like the taste in your mouth after you have thrown up from a hard night of drinking shots of tequila.  Ugh...
While not a 5 star ale, Miller Chill is a very refreshing pale lager and a great alternative to a Corona with a lime. When it is 90+ degrees, this is a great choice!
(Draught at Miller Brewhouse, Newark Airport, New Jersey). Embarrassingly pale yellow color, white head. Thin lime aroma. Artificial lime flavor, some late spices.
Way too much lime taste, not enough real beer. Doesn’t really capture the essence of a mexican beer. Carbonated lime water. This is not beer.
i gave it a 3 on appearance just ’cause it looks refreshing... but when it enters your mouth you’ll realize how much MORE refreshing it could actually be!
its a good mexican beer its very refreshing but if your new to it it has a strong lime taste to it which is ok i guese im not a big fan of lime beers but miller chill is one of my favorites

has a two finger bubbly white head that does not last long. has a small lime aroma with malt and corn. the flavor is carbonated lime water. no lacing and basically a lighter zima. pours a light yellow white color. ill pass.

Bottle -- My introduction to American beers was through the magnificent Anchor and Sierra Nevada (had quite a few SN porters on tap in LA once and have been in love ever since!) . So this one wasn’t so much a beer as a shock to the system. It seems Miller is cashing in on the popularity of Corona with a slice of lime, but has robbed us of the only redeaming quality of that tipple: The novelty of having a slice of lime bobbing about in the bottle. It’s refreshing, it’s light, it’s only vaguely cloying, but it isn’t beer!
Just a "hint" of lime? No way, Miller. It’s overpowering and has a funky aftertaste. Still, offer me one of these on a hot summer day and I would not turn it down.

Bottle. Why am I rating this? This is not beer. It’s liquid jolly rancher. The pour was almost like pouring seltzer water with a hint of yellow. It’s unlike the other Miller brands that have a urine yellow, this one is just light yellow. Weak pale head. Aroma is a bad mix of a lime soda and corn. The flavour is, well, as I stated earlier, like a liquid green jolly rancher. Now, I wouldn’t consider this a grotesque flavour to cause this beer to be a drain-pour. It’s bad, but it’s not nauseating. At the very least, it’s chuggable without gag reflexes. The after taste is pretty bad, though. But that’s when you chug it again or furiously drink some water.

Bottle. [Thanks to Shig]. Clear light yellow color with a average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, white head. Aroma is moderate citrus soda. Flavor is moderate sweet with a average to short duration. Body is light, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. (161207)

Heck, why not.  Crystal clear golden pour with a small white head.  Lemony-lime aroma.  Lots of carbonation.  The lime really attacks you.  One-dimensional, fizzy lime beer.  It’s not horrible and it might be good with some mexican food, who knows.

Cleanin’ out the beer fridge part 2. Thanks to my buddy Steve for leaving these in my beer fridge last year and drinking all my German beers. Well, if I am drain pouring might as well get a rating out of it. Pours clear pale gold with a thick stark white head. They make a very clean clear beer, thats for sure. Salty lime aroma, reminds me of doing tequila shots back in college. Malty corn sweet taste with that whole salt lime thing going on again. Finishes like it just disappeared, never even there.  Devoid of any real beer flavor and very much a drain pour. Gluglglugglugglugglugglugglugglug.
Bottle:  Golden colored pour with medium sized head.  Lemony, soapy aroma with a corona like finish.  I like this better than the Corona, but it’s still pretty watery.

I hate to say it, but for what it is, in the right place at the right time it isn’t bad. I’m talking about serious lawnmower beer. Not from a glass, not for pure beer enjoyment. This is a thirst quenching beer- period. That being said. I would never spend a penny for any, but if it was given to me after golfing 18 holes on a 95 degree day, it does the job. 

Please note that I wrote "For what it is"!!!

Horrible attempt at a Mexican beer, not to mention the cheesy "chelada style" ads. Nasty beer, nothing like a salty, lime beer like Corona. Tastes more sweet like smirnoff ice,then a beer. Too much sugary lime. Alot of women drink it. Expected more then i got.

This beer is terrible. Pours yellow just like a corona. Hints of lime and citrus in the aroma. Horrible salty and bitter taste with an even worse finish. I gagged a few times after i had taken a couple of sips. Terrible attempt at a corona.

nasty!!! I can’t stand this garbage please go away. I really hope this goes the way of crystal pepsi. The smell is nice and citris like, but the taste is just gross. I agree with everyone who said sour water. It really does taste like pure garbage.

Bottle. Pours yellow with a thick head. Smells like lime and citrus. Watery body, very carbonated, actually somewhat refreshing. Tastes like lime soda. Not to offensive, especially because I was sipping from a glass my girlfriend poured and didn’t actually have to drink a whole bottle

Yuck! Has to be one of the worst beers i have tried in a while, tasted like sour water how this product is still on the market baffles me the entire inventory of this brew should be recalled and disposed of immediately!
This is pretty horrible, I was given a free sample by the miller light girls at a B-Dubs one day.  Teenage girls would probably like it.

Another failure, miserable, and people are paid to produce this substance. Put it next to metho on the shelf. Aroma is like steel, and the hint of ’lime’ that is expected lacks and in the end defines its refined mass-butured contents. I mean, really, if you want lime in your beer, buy one from a store.

Rice and lime aroma. Ps yellow colour with small white head that dissapeared quickly. Yeap trying for that Corona clone look.
I think the quote goes, "Why did I spend money on this crap!!!"
i guess it is pretty refreshing, has a bit of a sour lime taste, its actually not all that bad.

Bottle: I was gonna save this for a milestone rating but why drink it twice? A clean hay hue in my pint glass topped by a fizzy head and minimal lace. The aroma is lemon lime soda with a hint of pale malt. Strangely I happened to like that aroma so by god I am giving it a 6! DEAL WITH IT... On to the taste, yep it tastes like lime soda with just a trace of pils malt and adjuncts. I do find a hint of salt on the aftertaste, how neato! The mouth feel is watery and strangely refreshing. I could see me actually drinking one of these with some Mex-Tex. Did I mention I like limes? Did I just say that?
terrible beer bitter lemon taste i guess try to see how bad it is because it is

"Inspired by a Mexican recipe with lime & salt." Chelada style. 

Is it a green bottle and clear beer, or the other way around? Let’s take the plunge...away we go...

Luckily, it’s that same old clear yellow color, with a 1/2 " fizzy white head. Meh.

Aroma, tart and sour, the lime is there, and little else. Hey, there’s the salt, too. Whoo-hoo, it’s margarita-beer! Not such a good thing. Who does this appeal to, I wonder? Not me, but in the interest of science, I soldier on...

Taste:...eeuugghayaa!!! Oooo, ...uhhhh,...errr...godamn, it is awful! And dreadful. And depressing. A wholly disheartening beer. A pale, sad light lager with absolutely horrid additives. I guess they’re latching on to some segment of the hispanic market, so hooray Miller, but who could, how could...why? why? why?

I’m almost sick from this crap already. I can taste the salt, and there’s that lime, and whoopee, there’s the booze, too. But there’s nothing redeeming in this no happiness is found in flavor or refreshment. You’re getting dumped.

And I’m going to rinse and slip an Imperial Stout down my gullet and forget this episode ever happened.

Incredibly drinkable at the beach, but not much else to it’s credit. Salt and lime flavors abound - an interesting style, but nothing great. I have had 1 good experience, and 1 terribly skunky, nasty experience with a 6 pick of Chill.

I hear Ross loves to drink this while he munches on Burritos. My neighbor brought this over for me to try. Pours a very translucent pale golden with a sudsy white retentive head. Aroma smells like lime juice with some sweet cereal like grains in the background. I am not sure why people are giving this poor scores on aroma and appearance, other than bias toward SAB. Oh well, it goes down from there. The dominating flavors here are lime and salt, countered by an overpowering adjunct sweetness. Finishes watery with a lingering saltiness. Interesting concept, bad beer. Perhaps less sweetness and some more hops to balance, and this beer could actually be tolerable. I am just happy that I did not pay for this. Time for a glass of  water. Blech.

12 oz. glass bottle- color of clear pale yellow, with a thin stark white head - nose of  cilantro, line zest, hay , grass , grainy and  slight bitterness – taste of lime juice ,and grain - body is light, acidic , and with high carbonation – aftertaste of lime peel , slight hint of hoppy bitterness

I don’t feel that much of a actual description is necessary. Its tastes like carbonation, sugar and some odd fruit like citrus? Its not even refreshing. I don’t believe in wasting beer so a put it in the freezer and was able to drink it when it was about 32.1 degrees.
Very refreshing.  Goes really well with Mexican food.  I’d take it over a Corona with lime any day.
a friend brought it over as a joke. Lime flavored alcopop. 1 half mouth full consumed, the rest down the drain.
Why are Americans so stupid?  I see people drinking this everywhere.  People come into bars and drink this!!! Why??
I bought this and actually expected it to be good.  I was wrong.  Added sugar and lime to the beer gives it a sweet aftertaste.  May be refreshing but still is not good.
Who ever thought this garbage up should be out of a job immediately!!!!!!!!

Free bottle from the Miller Girls at the Lawrenceville Beer Distributor. I guess that’s telling that they were giving it away. Pours pale yellow, white head. Aroma is lime, corn, malt, sort of smells like a messed up wine cooler. Flavor is the same and sugary, but not wine cooler sugary (maybe that would have been better). Tastes like an adjunct "beer". I admit I like Corona and this ain’t no Corona. Drain Pour.

12/7/07 Aroma is highly fruity with lots of sour green apple and a candilike sweet tart note.  Malt and hops are not recognizeable.  Appearance is clear light gold with a very well maintained white head and tons of carbonation bubbles.  Flavor is funky and sour, highly artificial.  Definitely more like a clear malt than a chelada; far less lime than a real homemade chelada as well.  I didn’t even finish this, that’s pretty amazing by itself.

A Mes rate: Bottle at Kerstfest, Essen thanks to Shig.
Pale gold with a thin white rim. Smells of lime and poo. Watery lime flavour. One of the most watery beers I have ever had. Grade A crap.

Macro lager with lime flavor.  Pretty bad.  My parents who live in PA bought this and hated it, which is pretty bad considering their favorite it Corona.  Gotta love PA distributing laws; now they have a whole case leftover.
This beer is horrible. I cannot see this beer staying on the market too much longer. Everyone I talk to hates it. It has too much of a malt taste to it to be labeled as a "beer".
It was gift. And a dare. Tasted like a Miller with artificial lime juice in it.
Bottled (thanks SHIG!). Yellowish golden colour, not much head. Aroma is lime, malts and some hops. Flavour is very much the same. Not totally bad, but rather uninspiring...
Overall, not bad for a cheap, light, flavored beer! My buddies claim "I could piss in a cup and it would taste better." 9 out of 10 surrounding us would also prefer his piss.

Bottle. Pours a clear straw yellow and had a light semi frothy head, actually had good retention. Aroma of light lime. Flavor is light lime, slight detection of very light malt. Palate is very light bodied, very high carbonation. Over all it is refreshing during a hot Texas summer, like a cold glass of ice water with a lime. I have no reason to buy this again though.

(Bottled, thanks SHIG/oh6gdx!) Very pale yellow, lemonadey, mostly fading head. Aroma of lemony dish-washing liquid and ginger. Slightly sweet and sour-acidic, ginger-lemony flavor with little hops. Very light-bodied, lemonadey and fizzy palate. A thirst quencher, but hardly a beer.
Bottle: Poured a clear to golden color with a white head, the bottle is very sharpe at least. The aroma is lime with malt and grain. The taste reminds me of sprite carbonation, malt, and more lime.
12 fl oz bottle, thanks to Patrick. Pours pale golden yellow with no head. Lemonish aroma like cleaning soap. Flavour is lemonish, bland. Not sweet nor citric - just bland.
This is not good. Put some salt, lime and water together and you have recreated this masterpiece. Disgusting
I am disappointed in my self for even trying this "beer". I dont even know what to say. Sould be very popular with fans of lime flavored corn.
WTF?  This sucks.  Not worth rating.  And where did they come up with that price?  OMFG.  This is obviously a "chick" beer.

Eh, I tried this beer with the miller beer standard fully in mind so that I wouldn’t be horribly dissapointed. It tastes like a cheap version or a knock off of corona with lime flavor added. I guess the best thing i can say about it is it has conveience on its side you dont have to buy limes. Has a salty aroma and finishes tart. For a cheap mass produced American lager it is tolerable but I wouldnt buy it.

Pours a pale golden, very little head at all. Aroma is sweet lime. Taste is light, but obviously limey. No real notice of hops, or malt. Crisp and very carbonated though. Overall, for what it is, its really not THAT bad. It’s surprisingly tolerable and I won’t say that for a lot of American macros.
Overall, not bad for a cheap, light, flavored beer!  My buddies claim "I could piss in a cup and it would taste better."  9 out of 10 surrounding us would also prefer his piss.

Pours a yellow gold, bright as bright - no surprises there - with a big artificial fluff formation atop that holds on, white as white, to lace nothing at all. It burps an eggy fart, sweaty sock, which quickly subsides to notes of mild, candied pear and processed lime juice. Very fresh flavoured, as lime is - though a bloody expensive addition to a beer, I’d say most is lemon citric acid. The lime-ish notes are dominant, though a doughy, double-cream flavour and feel sneaks on in. It is very, very light bodied to the point of watery though it is mineral-like, soapy and salty as it warms. Just plain, um, well, not beer at all really!!! (35,5cL, 21/02/08, the Beer Store Morley)
Bottle. Some lime notes, a Sprite with too much water. It’s not undrinkable but it isn’t much of a beer.
Has a bit of lime in the nose that isn’t altogether unpleasant. Pours a nice light pillsner colour. tastes like shit. oh well.

I give this a 2 for appearance as the thick, bright white head does last a long time. Otherwise it looks like any other light beer. Nose is of salt (blech!). No real lime detected. Tastes like sweat! Very little lime flavor. Heavy salt, though. This is really, really terrible! I see a lot of hispanics drinking this at the festival garibaldi and Mexican rodeos that are held at State Fair Park here in Milwaukee.
I finally had to try one. It sucks!

Recieved a free bottle when I purchased a new chain steering wheel for my low-rider. Drank from the bottle for the full effect. What bothers me most about these macro-swills has to be the carbonation. I can barely get through half of one of these before I have to belch for five straight minutes to clear the air. Strange drink, lime and corn combined into the water-thin body. Hops have been omitted entirely. Light malty finish that is characterized by a misplaced a magarita flair. A punishment to drink but not not as bad as it could have been - interesting from a Novelty Beer point-of-view.
Worst beer ever. Tastes like a cat took a piss in my mouth, and then I had to wash it down with diesel fuel.

I drank this from the bottle, so I can’t comment too much on the aroma or the color.  Overall it was difficult to taste the lime, I really only tasted from the aftertaste.  It was probably better than a miller lite, but definitely not great.

Been dodging this one for a couple weeks now. Salt initially on the nose then some lime. Very pale colour with a bit of a lasting head. Taste is not as offensive as I was expecting, all there seems to be is the lime and salt with very little beer characters.

This pale lager pours a fizzy yellow beer color from a 12 oz bottle. Large sized white foamy head. Aroma is corn, sweet, artificial lime flavor and corn. A light bodied pale lager flavored with a semi sweet artificial lime flavor. There also seems to be a touch of salt in the aftertaste. Lively carbonation. I guess there is some beer character in this stuff, not much though. Miller Marketing strikes again. Fill a market with a poorly made product. I have had worse. Mouthfeel is watery and thin. Finish is clean. Aftertaste is sweet with a pinch of salt.

Bottle.  Pour is an ominous, corn gold with a fizzy head that is more like soda than beer.  Aroma?  Darned if I can find one... maybe a touch of a saly corn smell with some lime, but not inviting.  Flavor is horribly artificial... corn and fake lime.  Much too sweet for a beer with no hops or malt presence (apart from fermented corn.)  I wish I could say that it is a nasty beer, but beer might be a generous assessment.  Yuck!
had this 1 when it came out not bad but its over priced for a miller product it has a light taste the lime taste is weak not worth the money
Not as bad as I expected, but definitely not enough lime in it unless provided by your own hand and pocketbook. Too salty without the lime.

Shandy in a bottle. Not as bad as I expected, the Spanish do similar pre-mix beers. Slight Saccharine to it and would probably get a thumbs up with the girls.
Lime nose, slight green tinge to the colour, flavour is mainly lime which covers the regular corn flavours. Finish is slight lime too with little to no bittterness. I honestly expected worse, much worse.

Rotgut dreamed by idiotic marketing types in Miller.  How about this novel idea Miller  ... make a beer that tastes like hops and malt?  Ever think of that idea?  Huh?  

Oh our beer has more taste than budlight.  Huh?  So does a bucket of horse manure ... what does "more taste" have to do with "good beer"?  You use corn, they use rice .. corn has more overt flavor.  Whoo hoo.  

Now that we’ve got that out of the way, lets reexamine Chill.  Tastes like a salty 7-up.    Nasty, vile stuff.

Bottle @ Pre RBSG. 7up...that will get you drunk apparently. What a funny night that was, although maybe not as funny as the next morning when Facto’s doing kept licking Dave’s feet/legs. Good times...refreshing...not unlike 7-up.
tasted like sprite then got worse as i didn’t drink it and it sat. the initial sip wasn’t bad but i didn’t even finish it.

Why feel the need to export this to Nelson Bay, NSW Aust?  Nasty cloying lime cordial overpowers a cheap and nasty brew.  Horrid pale straw colour.  Don’t know where Chelada is but will be keeping away.
Pale yellow with fizzy white head.  Aroma is bit of grass with hints of lime and vomit. The aroma goes directly into the taste.  It’s like a bad soda with salt. Definitely interesting.

Clear pale yellow in color with a large white head which rapidly dissipates to very little. Thin bodied, average carbonation, fizzy. The lime leaves a slightly sweet aftertaste. Doesn’t taste bad or anything but it’s not exactly beer. Not great.
Pale yellow with virtually no head. Sweet fruity fizzy  soft drink.Hard to rate it as a beer because I can’t taste any beer.
Sprite. Thats all I can get from this beer. Sprite. Oh, and it’s not a "chelada" or michelada. needs tomato for that. but awful.
Beer and Lime normally shouldn’t be mixed. Miller did a decent job of doing this with out having to "fruit the beer". Good chug beer, but not a fav.
This is HORRIBLE. Remember Tequiza? It’s exactly like that. You’d think Miller would take a hint at the fact that it’s not around anymore and not make a clone of it. Ech.

Tastes like a Miller lite with a lime twist.  It’s better than I thought it would be, just because, although skunky, it’s easy to chug and satisfies thirst with all the carbonation and lime accent.  I’ll take this over MGD anytime.  That’s not saying much, but go ahead and try it.  It’s like Corona with a lime.

I knew miller is a bad brewer, but I didn’t expect this. Honestly when I heard that it tasted like lime I thought it was a marketing ploy that would prove to be mostly false. I was wrong.  Riding the weak corn flavors back to lime town only prolongs the inevitable watery lager dirtnap that awaits you.
Another abortion by a macrobrewer, lime and salt belong in a margarita, not a beer.  It’s nothing more than Miller Lite with a slice of lime and a pound of salt thrown into the bottle...horrid
I hate this stuff ... I cannot place the flavor, maybe it’s the "natural flavor" but something made me want to wretch after tasting this stuff.  yuck

To me it tasted like a skunky mexican beer. I will have to try it with a actual lime instead of the notional one that they added for me. Not good and wouldn’t try it again unless I found it for very very cheap.

12 oz bottle.  Pours a clear fizzy light yellow with a fizzy rocky white head that retains well and leaves a little lacing.



The aroma is sweet corny macro malts with some sugary lime-like tequila.



The flavor is sweet corn malts and lots of sugary lime and some mint with a bit of a skunky off-malt aftertaste.  The mouthfeel is light to medium bodied with sharp fizzy carbonation.



Overall, it’s not beer - more of a malternative.  But surprisingly, it is drinkable.  I have had worse beers, and this is better than most macros.

Sampled at GWBF 2007.  The only reason I tried this beer was because it was there and it saves me from having to buy it.  Served from a 12 oz. bottle.  Pours a very, very pale gold with a fizzy white head that quickly disappeared.  Really no aroma to speak of. Very light lime flavor and very watery. Overcarbonated. An interesting concept but a poor effort.

I didn’t think it got worse than Miller Lite, but I am wrong.  I took a sip just to see what the fuss was about.  Of course you can imagine that lime and salt don’t belong, neither does the rest of the beer.  Shitty.

It’s alright, but without the body of a real beer to broadcast the lime flavor.  Comes off a little like a limeade, and a weak one at that.  But it’s a nice concept.  Btw, what the hell is Chelada style?

no i didn’t pay for this.  a friend bought a six, drank one and now they sit in the fridge just incase theres NOTHING else to drink.  that was tonight.  smells like someone crammed a bunch of limes in a bud light.  i guess it was ok.  terrible god awful aftertaste though.  Miller had a chance to make this drinkable and didn’t get it.  If there was as much limes in the taste as the smell, i wouldn’t have to choke it down as much.
I got horribly sick off miller chill and threw up. It smells good but i can not drink this. the carbonation and the lime is just bad.
clear very fizzy like a sprite but taste very chemical and fake worst miller product i’ve tryed

I decided to try this with an open mind and also because it was free.  One of the more heinous substances I have ever put in my mouth.  Clear golden yellow pour with fizzy head.  This tastes more like a Sierra Mist or Fresca that has gone bad rather than just a bad Miller beer product.  Has an extreme artificial, chemical taste to it.  The "brewmaster" who came up with this should be flogged.

Appearance: Oh-so fizzy! Pours a crystal clear, pale yellow body with a fizzy, white head.

Smell: Oh, how it stinks! Artificially flavored lime soda with strong notes of sorrow and unhappiness.

Taste: Semi-sweet, artificial lime flavor with a tiny pinch of salt and sumptuous notes of abused gym bags.

Mouthfeel: Thin-bodied. Medium carbonation.

Drinkability: Ugh. A horrendous mix between a Zima and a Corona, it doesn’t sit well and is a bit of a stomach churner.

This beer reminded me of a powerade flavor I used to love.   I forget which flavor, but not lemon or lime.  Clear gold pour, lime on the nose.   I actually didnt completely hate it, but it is what it is
The artificial lime flavoring, although having no place in a beer or anywhere else, does actually make this better than a few other options out there.
Tastes like a particularly characterless macro light beer with a heavy dose of lime mineral water. Do people enjoy this?

Bottle. Leave it to Miller to figure a way to take a flavorless beer (Miller Lite) and turn it into a beer that tastes like a bad batch of Fresca. The artificial lime taste in this is unbearable. Question: Does Chelada mean sphincter in Spanish?

This isn’t a beer.  This is soft alcopop.

A tasty refreshing beverage, but it’s not beer. more of a malt beverage.   Whoever decided that this should be served in a stein is a schmuck.

Oh my god this is awful! I actually thought it might be decent coming in but I was so so wrong. Smells like a dirty old lime sitting in an old moldy fruit crate. If you washed out the inside of that crate with some swill beer and poured into a glass, thats what this tastes like. A true one sip drain pour.

Thanks to my friend Dave for this sample- Clear golden/yellow with a large fizzy white, pop style fizz. Lemony-lime aid aroma. Like lime cordial almost. Some corn.Flavour is light lime with super light beer. Fairly refreshing I suspect in the warmer months on the patio. Finishes light, with lots of lime.

Rating #500,  heck yes.  Clear golden with small white fizzy head.  Aroma of artificial lime, slat, and vomit.  sweet artificial lime, way to much salt, and crappy pale lager grain.  Would probly work well as radiator fluid.

really junky beer. Tastes simalar to a Zima in terms of the non-beer taste with lots of artifical sugars and flavors. Doesnt mix well with the beer, after a couple sips you get disgusted by the taste.

Had this beer on 6/11/2007.  Aroma is a nice sweet lime scent.  Color is a very light gold with good carbonation and loose head.  Taste is light and fruity.  Starting with a light body it goes down light with a crisp feel.  Finish is a mild sweet flavor with back tones of lime.  In the end it is very clean and refreshing.  Overall I like it, now normally I would not give a light beer like this such a high rating but, I feel they nailed what they where trying to do.  This is a great light and refreshing beer that has a great lime taste.  Its a perfect summer brew and is far far better then shoving a piece of lime in a Corona.
Tastes of artificial lime and salt.  I did not care for it at all.  There are much better selections out there.

Ugh...I admit I am a slave to ratings and I bought this fully aware that I wasn’t going to like it a boy was I right. Aroma was nothing but the faintest lager smell. Pour was like a piss after you’ve drank a lot of water. Alomst clear. There was a generous 2 finger white head which got it a point. Taste was like heavily carbonated water with a dash of lime in the aftertaste. I took one for the team on this one.

#1100  12 oz. bottle - Pours a clear light golden color with a one finger thick white head.  Lively carbonation.  Light lacing.  Aroma is light grain and light citrus.  Flavor has a light malt sweetness with a nice citrus zing.  No lingering aftertaste.  Light body.  I don’t think it’s as bad as everyone says it is.  I think it’s good for our AZ summers.
Not the worst,Nice golden color,grainy faint citrus aroma.The flavor was nothing special,grainy citrusy taste,and easy to drink,kind of grows on you after a 6/pk.Lawnmower brew all the way.
Why would anyone want to mimick a crap brew like corona?  Lime taste, give me a break.  Some people need to grow a set and drink real beer.

eh, this wasnt terrible, but it certainly wasnt great.  Flavor is just as it says, but rather thin.  Not something i will ever drink again, but nice to try once.

Re Rate, as this thing warmed, it was disgusting.  What the hell were they thinking.
Lemon-lime aroma. Light bodied taste of lime and is quite tart. Not very beery, but it isn’t as bad as I expected. It’s drinkable and nearly indistinguishable from a Zima with lime juice.
this was one of the most disgusting things i have ever tasted in my life. the lime and salt combo mixed in w/ the miller made me wish i hadnt wasted my money on it
honestly, buy some corona or any other light/pale lager and put some lime and salt in it.  this tastes like a dumbed down and chemically induced version of that.  this is not beer, it is disgusting.

Had a 24 of this over the summer.  Started off as a decent take on corona with lime.  Really not much to this beer, run of the mill swill with the noticeable salt and lime.  At first it was tolerable on a warm day.  However, after a while it began to simply taste of chemicals.  Will not go back to have another.
The real question is WHY?  Every other miller beer doesn’t have the disgusting flavor of this beer, very bad attempt to knock off corona.
Not really what I would consider a beer. Tastes good on a warm summer day. Lime and salt taste is overpowering. Very light color with almost no head.
Dear God this sucks ass, why did I ever try it?  Got a bottle from my sister who thinks Zima is sofisticated, she is very wrong!!!

Amazing how fast this got 280 ratings. I was really excited to locate a bottle of this at a party that I could sneak out and drink in the comfort of my own home. I knew the experience would be divine. The supple lemon-lime aroma is piquant and flattering. The beer rolls through the mouth, salty and fragrant, with hints of ass, trash, and a sweet prune danish. One sip was all I needed of this heavenly nectar. I happily poured the rest down the drain knowing that I had tasted the best and I never need go back.

Poured to what appeared to be beer, no head.  A sharp fruit smell with an almost stale beer tang kicked in for good measure.  My first sip wanted to make me spit it back out- citrus/ bad beer taste.  Horrid- avoid.

They were handing out free samples of this shit at NFL Sunday in the Hilton hotel & casino (if you love football Sunday, and you’re in Vegas, this is the place to be, trust me). The best thing about this trainwreck was the cute Millergirls handing it out. A shandy-style lager that fails completely. Waaaay too synthetic and too sweet, coming across as a lime cooler with no detectable lager character at all. Aweful.
I just wanted to say that I wouldn’t drink this fuckin garbage even to dilute a belly full of fuckin poison...what is this shit...oh wait, I know 12 ounces of gimmicky horse shit!
From bottle poured a pale urine color with almost no head.  citrusy aftertaste, on a bad beer flavor.

I rate this beer .1 of a point higher than Miller Lite just because it actually has some sort of tast to it.  If I wanted to drink water with lime and salt I would buy Aquafina and put some Twang in it.

I tried this after a friend ordered it.....the smell is some faint lime and some terribly offensive thing that I can’t place (soap?) in there, the taste is so awful I almost wanted to drink Miller Lite to get the taste out of my mouth.  Terrible, terrible, terrible, terrible.
Lighter gold, thin white head.  Nose is lemon, odd pork chop notes - rosemary.  Flavor is lemon lime soda, artificial sweeteners.  A hint of very light malt in the finish.

12 oz bottle, at a friend’s daughters birthday party.  Being that I was never planning on buying this beer, I was pleased to be able to try it under the circumstances.  Pour is straight pale lager, with perhaps less head.  Aroma typical macro grain, really not much of the extras (lime and salt).  Taste was actually much smoother than Miller Lite.  I thought the lime and salt were very muted, and actually quite nicely blended.  Not a bad drink by any means, and perhaps something I would prefer over normal Miller line up.  Did I have a second?  Nope, they had Sierra Nevada too.

12 ounce bottle. Shaker glass. Pale golden with a thin head. Aroma - grain and a hint of lime. As advertised the flavor was dominated by lime and salt in a pale lager. Maybe slightly better than High Life or MGD, but still lags behind Corona with a healthy dose of lime added.

Pours pale transparent yellow into the glass, with a nitrous-induced head that diminishes to nil, leftover spotty suds lace.  A tiny bit of lime, but pretty much no real nose available.  The flavor is certainly lime-tainted, almost soda-like.  Very reminiscent of Tequiza, honestly.  No real body or substance.  If you’re in the mood for a better alternative to traditional macros, you might give this a try.  No real flavor present.  All produced, nothing natural.  Light and seltzery, but I hate to admit that it doesn’t really go down as awfully as I expected.

12 oz. bottle into a pint glass.  Very light aroma with corn, malt, and a touch of citrus.  Not really distinguishable as lime, just some sort of citrusy fruit.  Piss yellow and fizzy, head is fizzy white and is gone almost immediately.  Ugly.  Flavor is immediately crisp and acccompanied by a light citrus that goes away but reappears in the aftertaste.  I notice the fruit more, but I really dont like it.  Slight hop character, but not really.  Milldy refreshing, but the lim kills it.  Not a bad mouthfeel, crisp.
Premixing lime into a beer is not a good idea.  What works for soda clearly does not work here.  Lame, but made me appreciate Corona w/ fresh lime just a bit more.

Sampled from a 12 oz green bottle this beer poured a pale golden color with a small white head that fades almost instantly. The aroma was sweet, tangy margarita. The flavor was dryish, salty and citrusy with a hint of pepper. There was no real beer flavor here. This tastes just like the watery dregs of a margarita that has been sitting nearly finished for a while and then I suck up through the straw before leaving the restaurant.  Yeah, just like that.
A good beer for drinking in the hot sun of columbia sc. I had ice cold and found it to be very refreshing. You can definately taste the salt and lime. Different but good!
Ehhh, not too bad, but not great. Very sweet and artificial tasting. Another good one for the girlfriend

this is a great beer....if you don’t like beer.  Light, no flavor and well....light.

It’s not a good beer.

Pours a light yellow with a small white head into the lager glass.  Smells like lime and piss.  Tasted about the same, with salt, lime, and very strange taste...that almost reminded me of beer.  I was pressured into this one.
This seems to be Millers take on Corona. What I don’t get though is why any one would want to copy a shit beer like Corona. This is a perfect example of marketing having too much control.

Scary green bottle. Aroma very citrusy which overpowers anything beelike about this. Very sweet immediately with a fast disapating taste of sugar and citrus that ends in just cold fizzy water. Reminds me moreso of Jones Soda. This is only being consumed because it’s a leftover from last weekend BBQ and we ran out of Busch. Yes, we drank teh leftover Busch before this. Someone please pass me something from Blue Point before I get out of hand...

I bought this on a Labor Day trip to the Outer Banks of North Carolina as a potential alternative to Corona.  At home I generally like a big Belgian or stout but on the beach, gotta have Cerveza!  As I opened the first one, I noted a nose similar to a Corona with a hint of lime.  I poured into the glass and noted a bit of a lighter color than you would find in other light Mexican beer.  To this point, I felt as if I found a cheaper alternative with no worries of cutting my fingers while slicing limes after the first 3 or 4!  Then I took the first taste...not exactly what I had anticipated.  The taste was closer to a weak Zima or Sprite.  While it was refreshing on a hot beach day, it was a bit disappointing based upon the product description.  It gets some credit for being a day at the beach thirst quencher but I think I will be returning to my old faithful Corona the next trip.
A really good tasting beer.  Not too strong and just about the right added taste.  Different from other beers... Which is nice to have.
(on tap @ brews in the village)i didnt know vomit came in a bottle.id really like to say more,but that about sums it up.

Poured pale yellow with a foamy white head. Chemical nose and flavor that reminded me of an energy drink.  Somewhere between Gatorade and Tang.  Nasty.  Nothing about this seemed the least bit natural or refreshing.
Aroma is wet paper with some lime. Pale gold color with a white head that ringed. Rather thin bodied, with fizzy carbonation. Lime soft drink flavor. Not much else to say.

Bottle, courtesy of buddies wife. Pours pale yellow with frothy white head. Aroma is sweet malt and very citrusy and lemon-lime. This stuff is like sprite beer. Flavor is more of the same, almost completely dominated by the lemon-lime tartness balanced with soda pop sweetness. Fortunately this one doesn’t share the same artificial and disgusting lime like presence that tequiza had but it is still overwhelming. It was refreshing though, however I’d never drink another as long as I live.

Bottle. This may be the worst beer I have ever had. Pale yellow body. aroma is soft and of faint lime. Flavor is weak, bland and tasteless. Did not taste like a lager more like some water mixed with some cheap store brand kool-aid. Horrible mess of a beer.
Shared with Kinz for an impromptu tasting. Clear pale yellow body with a small fizzy white head. Citrus and salt aroma, almost of vomit. Flavor of lemon and cheap tequila in the end.

bought a 12-pack (sorry, my mistake) just to try it.  will certainly not purchase this again.  has a skunky smell and an even worse taste.  whose the guy who allowed this to go into production?  Hey, let’s sit back and enjoy a nice cool glass of chiwawa piss.(Dirty Work---any one, any one???) well whatever.  this beer is somewhat refreshing on a hot day, but certainly not something I would pay for again.

Had a bottle at a friend’s BBQ.  Is this beer?  It looked like a duck but didn’t walk or quack like one.  The "hint of lime" was NOT subtle.  It was like a sour lime-aid with a splash of O’Douls thrown in for good measure.  I admit the first sip was refreshing on this hot day--but I haven’t found a beer that has a first sip that’s not refreshing.  Sadly, I’m not surprised that this stuff has a following.  I’d drink it again for free.
Tastes like a 1:1 mixture of lime soda and Miller beer...with a dash of salt.
Wow tasted like they took their worst beer and added lime and a little salt.  Might have been better with more citrus.

Are they serious?  These people have to be joking, right?  There’s no way this is actually on the market, verdad?  Ha.  And I’m the one that actually took a sip of it.  I can seriously imagine chasing tequila with this stuff, though.

First whiff is of public beach bathroom, heavy on urinal.  This isn’t looking good.  Interesting, taste(?).  Some kind of cough drop lemony-lime flavor on top of carbonated pee-water.  Stinker almost on level with Anheuser World Select.

You know, I kinda like Corona w/ a lime and salt on the rim. It takes an average to foul beer and makes it somewhat drinkable. Never gonna be an everyday thing for me but sometimes it’s OK. This, on the other hand, is useless. I will admit that it does a reasonable job of replicating the original beverage--right down to that Corona skunk--but honestly, w/o the fresh lime and actual grains of salt, it looses all its charm.

Back in the day, Miller was always my favorite of the BMC’s. That, along with the fact that I enjoyed a Tecate with lime, made me think this might be halfway decent. WRONG!!

I don’t know what the flavor was in this, but it wasn’t lime, unless it was lime flavored soap. Not only did it not enhance the flavor, it basically ruined the entire beer. 

Nose, flavor and palate were all this fruity-soapy mix, that never got better. I had to pour the bottle dwon the drain at mid-glass.

Probably one of the ten worst beers I’ve ever had.

Thanks to maniac for saving me form actually having to spend money on this.  Pale fizzy yellow.  Aroma is that of Miller Lite, faint corniness with a hint of salt added in.  Flavor has lime candy as it warms, corn, and some salt.  Not good.  It lost a point from my original rating because when I went back and took my last swallow, I got a bad tequila shot shiver from the beer.

Bottle:  Fairly dark yellow with a large white lagereque head.  Nose is somewhat inviting if you’re into lime spritzers.  Taste is about what I’d expected - Highly carbonated lemon lime soda mixed with salt and dirty malts.  I’d be happy to never see/smell/drink this ever again.

Date: 06/21/2007

Mode: Bottle

Source: Tasting, Pre-RBSG



clear pale yellow, frothy white head, drippy lace, 
light sweet malt aroma with strong key lime pie character, 
sweet lime flavor, very clean, nice lime soda but not beer



Aroma: 4/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 4/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 8/20

Rating: 2.2/5.0
Drinkability: 6/10

Score: *+/4

Uh... this has a pale yellow colour. White head that is like pop fizz. Aroma of some kind of Lime and adjuncts. The flavour of the beer is nothing. The lime flavour disipates very quickly. Plate of water.

THOUGHTS: The flavor in this beer went from 60 to 0 in 1 second flat. There was a bunch of flavor, which wasn’t necessarily great, just strong and then it was just gone. The salt must counteract the sour part of the lime, becuase when there was flavor it was all sweet lime. If you are going to try this one, it is one of those rare beers that actually tastes a little better straight from the bottle.
TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poured a light yellow with tons of variously sized bubbles and an average, soapy, white head that mostly diminished. The aroma was light grain and moderate lime and maybe some salt. The flavor was mostly sweet and acidic with some bitterness, sourness and some salt. The initial flavor was not bad. It was mostly lime and just a tad of salt, but then the finish was awful. It was like watered down Tequeza or flat 7 up poured into a Miller Lite. Thankfully the finish was short. The light body watery at first and then suddenly dry. It had fizzy carbonation at first that later became softer. The finish feel was moderately to heavily astringent.

This beer is messed up! So freakin weak, I got it for free at a miller promotion at a bar. Just cause it was free I had it, I would never buy this beer again. My friends and I agreed that this was a girly drink. What I’m surprised at is the alcohol content 4.2% wow!
nice alternative to corona, however a bit limy - nice to enjoy a few of these on a summer eve.
NEWTIMESBEERFREST07. Nose is artificial lime. Tastes like a mixture of Sprite and Gatorade. I can’t give this any points, as it lacks any comparison to what I know as beer.

Bottle at Don Hall’s @ Coventry, FW, IN. Large white fizzy head that was mostly lasting, fair amount of lacing, transparent, visible carbonation, and a yellow hue. Nose was very sweet, lime and salty. Ditto for flavor along with a thin flavor. Smooth, thin mouthfeel and light body. If you like sweet tasting beers, have at it. Didn’t taste like a "real" beer IMO and definitely one that I will not drink again. Try it and decide for yourself.
Why? Why did Tom have this beer? Why did Tom leave it for me? Why did I keep it? Why did I decide to drink it? Why am I rating it? Why oh Why?
sneezer thinks this beer is tasty.  it is limey.  um, the bottle is pretty and spoo is pretty.  and tony is pretty.  puppies are cute, and like this beer, make sneezer feel soft and cuddly.

The current style for this (pale lager) is wrong--it should be a spice/fruit/vegetable.  What’s notable about this beer is how much the fruit dominates the flavor.  In fact, my reaction is that it blurs the boundaries between wine cooler and beer.  The sense of lager here is relatively low; much more I get the lime, especially in the finish.  I like lime a lot, so it makes this beer much more drinkable than any regular pale lager.  I think this one will prove a hit with some people (esp. women?) who have always been turned off by the regular flavor of the macro beers, such as Miller Genuine Draft.

Usually I would put more effort into a rating, write it down, work through the difficult numbers that would go into it.  However, I found this beer to be in a league of its own.  The kind of league that no human being with a better palate than a sophomore frat boy would care to join.  The only word I’ve found to describe this tepid, inexhaustibly bad "brew" is: ugh.
This beer smells like a hair salon Hint of lime.   Light yellow color.  I hear it is intended to compete with Corona, but unlike Corona, this is undrinkable.

Ok...this is a tough one to rate. But I’m trying it so I might as well get a "tick" on RB, huh?  So they claim it is a "Chelada Style"...lets see what Wikipedia has to say about Chelada. "The Chelada is a beverage that is created by adding the juice of one or two limes to a full glass of ice cubes and then pouring twelve ounces of a dark Mexican beer into the glass. The rim of the glass is typically salted." 

So...first off this is not a dark Mexican beer at all. More like miller light or I guess maybe Corona. With a bunch of artificial lime juice...and hints of salt.  But the thing is...if I had a huge burritto in front of me with a bunch of hot sauce, salsa and cheese all over it on a hot summer day. This beverage might actually be alright. 

But...this is Rate Beer so I have to rate it as a "beer". So here we go: 


Pours a a golden piss yellow with a medium creamy white head that yes...actually left some lacing.  Aroma of lime juice and hints of some light pale lager in there.  Flavors of lime, some salt...and yes some pale lager character...but not a whole lot hidden under all that lime. Again...I would drink this with a very spicy Mexican dish although I would prefer to go with a Rita.  I would pick this over Corona though.

Bottle. Pretty much Miller Lite with what they say-- lime and salt. Refreshing early on, with a nice crisp lime underneath the light, crisp beer, but towards the end of the bottle the lime devolves into syruppy sweetness. Not great, but not horrible either-- I wouldn’t turn it down.

Had this right in the bottle, and didn’t really get a feel for aroma or appearance. As for the taste, I actually found it to be very drinkable and refreshing. The lime and salt do overpower the watered-down Miller Lite taste, and made this one better than I anticipated.
smooth, refreshing, plesantly refreshing and no aftertaste yeah right combination of sweet and salt I love it!
Well, at least this one had a nose.  Unfortunately, I can only describe the smell as that of human hair (the salon down the block comes to mind...).  The taste was lightly citrus but not very salty.

12oz green bottle.  VERY very light yellow translucent body (almost the color of water - really one of the lightest beers I’ve ever seen) with a thin white film.  Smells prodominantly fruity - like natural lime flavor with a fair bit of salt too.  Tastes sweet, like lime flavoring with a little salt in the background.  Kind of reminds me of Sprite or Sierra Mist.  Extremely light in body with a lot of carbonation.  Relatively refreshing, though I have to say one review I’ve read was spot-on about this being "borderline malternative".  Not horrible (though the salt flavor could be toned down a bit), but definitely not something I’ll be drinking of my own volition or on my own dime anytime soon.
I couldn’t find enough taste to even dislike it. I thought someone was goofing with me!

I must thank Skyview for opening this at the tasting, so I don’t have to shell out money for it.  Dark yellow color with a thick head.  JK said it exactly: "This smells like a haircut.  It’s like walking into Great Clips."  Can’t say it better than that!  Tastes like a horridly watered down margarita, minus the tequila.  So we’re left with salt water and lime.  Oh yum, pour me another!

Hardly what I’d call a "beer", lime flavor is poor, saltiness is reminiscent of sweat, very little flavor or aroma of beer.  Tasted OK when I had my first swig, as it was very cold, but flavor got nasty as the temperature increased.   One would be much better off to take their own favorite light or Mexican beer, slice up a lime and add a dash of salt---don’t waste your $$$ on Chill.

Sampled at Tijuana Flats in Orlando.  Pours a pale straw color with no head.  Aroma is very faint, stale cereal and lime.  The taste is of Sierra Mist and sweat, throw in some unneeded high fructose corn syrup and CO2, and you have this rancid concoction.  It gets a "1", it could be worse...  Avoid the noid.
Eh, not so bad. Still better than other stuff the big three has put out. Nother beer thats nice on a hot day.
I actually like this beer a lot.  Great to drink in the morning/afternoon... if your at the beach or something.  Clean, refreshing taste and nice unique lime flavor.  I will buy this again.
Pretty boring really... not really too much lime, just not enough beer... honestly I can’t say I could taste beer at all.  Oh well, another rating I suppose.

12 oz bottle, no date at the Hill Top 08/08/07.  Clear pale straw with a 1/4 finger fizzy white head with no retention.  First thing I smell is Bazooka Joe bubblegum.  Then comes some Sprite.  It doesn’t smell bad, but it doesn’t smell like anything related to beer.  The flavor is Sprite, fake lime, and more Bazooka Joe.  There simply isn’t any beer flavor.  Watery and fizzy with moderate carbonation.  This is more along the lines of Smirnov Ice and whatnot.  Corona and lime tastes better than this crap--at least it has elements of beer in it.
Eh.  Generic.  Can’t personally say I could taste the advertised lime and salt.  Won’t be a beer of choice again.

My problem with this beer is that it doesn’t taste ANYTHING like beer. It doesn’t even taste like a regular macro beer. 

It’s weird. Not for me.

7/20-21/2007: Miller Chill is pale, light, and smells and tastes like weak artificial lime Jello.  Um, yeah...  Not a "beer" for me!



12 oz bottle at The Pig Skin in Athens, Ohio during the Ohio Brew Week 2007.  Bought by Lance for Matt (mball581).  Rating #214 for this beer...

Free samples at Dempsey’s Ale House. Pale  light golden pour. Thin fizzy body with a fruity-pebble cereal aroma. Flavor has a hint of lime and sugary artificial flavors. Vacant finish. Basically on target, in terms with what I expected.

Yes I did... and no it wasn’t!!!                           
Green 12oz bottle  "Miller with salt and lime?"   Pours clear yellow.  Aroma of key lime flavored salt water taffy.  Flavor of vomit and gag!  Finish of a Miller Lite.  The only way this beer sells... Must be Mass Marketing.   Save Your Money!
this stuff is a disgrace to beer. it tastes like smirnoff ice and mountain dew

Poured a light blonde color with a good, smooth white head that left right away.  Aroma was of macro beer, nothing really distinct - just beer smell.  Tasted like a Miller lite, with about half of the taste and some lime added to it, no noticable taste of salt.  Aftertaste was mellow.  Not too bad for a gimmick beer, taste leaves a lot to be desired though.
Starts off like a zima, finishes like a flat mountain dew.  Fizzy and yellow with a lime aroma.  Might be refreshing on a hot summer evening, but not to be taken seriously as a beer.

OK, this beer is hard to rate, because it does taste pretty good, but it is not much of a beer.   It tastes strongly of lime, like a half a lime was squeezed in there, with alot of carbonation and some pale malt in the background.  Aroma is all lime, maybe a little pale malt.  Pours a pale straw color with a fizzy head that dissipates and leaves nothing behind.  Without the lime taste this would probably be just a really plain crappy light beer.
The aroma isnt too bad, lots of lime. The flavor is barely beer like with a ton of lime. Strange, wouldnt drink it again.
Not the worst but more of a novelty beer.  The salt and lime is very muted but to me it does taste better than miller lite.
the aroma was the only thing this crap has going for it.  st pattys green with tastes of cheap margareitta mix.  one sip and down the drain....

poured a pale yellow/gold with a touch of green. moderate frothy head. smelled strongly of lime. the taste was lime and salt, as if someone poured a margarita into about 20 ounces of water....and took out the tequila.
mouthfeel was pleasant. aftertaste was unpleasant.
overall, it’s better than most any macro i’ve ever had, and oddly refreshing. It would honestly go well with spicy mexican food or wings. If you are looking for a beer-drinker’s beer, this isn’t it. But for the masses, it sure as hell beats the rest of the retarded college kid lagers.

Not good.  Bought a six-pack on a whim after riding for ~8 hours on a motorcycle in the heat and sun of Central Illinois.  Made me want to get back on the bike, sore ass, sunburn and all.  You can smell the lime and you can taste the salt -- would that it were the other way ’round.

Pours like piss through a moldy jock strap, an oddly radioactive looking pale yellow. Tastes like a piss poor margarita gone wrone. Weak. Mostly tasting like lime flavored jolly ranchers, with a bit of salty aftertaste--like the remnants of a nose bleed. Hell, how can they even call this beer? One shudders to consider that it isn’t even the worst light brew out there...

if it tasted like real light beer, if it tasted like real limes, if the "lime" wasn’t stronger than a lime could possibly be, if the salt wasn’t included at all as that doesn’t go in beer that already doesn’t taste like REAL limes. if it wasn’t for all these things, it could of been a true version of a chelada, something that wasn’t good to begin with.

saw at a bar and thought i’d give it a try to see what i wasn’t missing.  very light, very thin, if it wasnt for the added lime and salt flavor, it would be water.  tastes like a corona light with a lime, about what i expected.

You can definately smell the lime.  A pale yellow color, with a small white head.  Not the best thing that I’ve ever tasted, but it is quite refreshing when drank cold.   The taste actually reminds me more of Zima than other peoples evaluation of Corona with lime.  I am actually one of what seems like a few that actually likes Miller Lite, so I bought a whole case of this stuff.  I will probably finish the case, but probably won’t buy this beer again, atleast not in bulk.  If I want a mexican beer then I will buy a Mexican beer, not a poor imitation.  This beer was just ok.
12ozer. basically flavored water. weak salty carbonated taste. probably what bottled sweat tastes like. real bad.

Even though I figured I wouldn’t care for it, I hoped I would. I was one of the few people who actually liked Tequiza. 

Poured pale yellow. Almost no head. No lacing. Aroma was of faint citrus and  bread. Flavor was light on everything. Lime, yeast, salt, corn, whatever was in this can barely be tasted. Mostly, it tasted of slightly tangy water. Palate was smooth and thin. Overall, this was not very good. I wasn’t expecting much, and I was still disappointed.
This is the worst thing I have ever tasted in my life.. period. It smells like vomit, and tastes like a fruit drink mixed with butt hole.. I can’t imagine that anyone could actualy enjoy this.

I’ve been curious about the Miller Lite Chelada style’s flavor since I saw the lime green bottles hit the shelves.  I even almost bought a bottle for $2.50 @ a local watering hole the other week.   But a freebee via an end of shift drink got me to try Miller Chill.   Pale lager, with a puff of foam, some salt and natural lime aftertaste.   Nothing heavy-duty going on here, its in the same vain as Corona.

pours yellow with a small white head, very carbinated.
smells of lime and old grass.
taste is like a corona with lime, but a little bit better, fizzy.  bad aftertaste.
not that great.

Pour is a sick looking yellow with a fizzy white head.  Aroma is nothing.  Some skunk and even that is hard to detect.  Flavor is about the same.  Some lime but the wet paper bag takes over everything.  Its easy to rip on a bad beer but this one deserves what it gets.

This bottled brew from a restaurant poured a large sized head of foamy finely sized white colored bubbles that were mostly diminishing and left behind a nearly uncarbonated straw yellow colored body. The aroma was malty astringent and full of dirty socks. The mouth feel was smooth at the start and mildly tingly at the finish. The mild flavor contained notes of lime salt malt and hops.  Ugh please pass on this one!

Wow! What was Miller thinking? First, I do not drink light beers. I listened to what Brewmaster Joe Pickett said ears ago when asked if he would brew a light beer. He stated "If you want a light beer put an ice cube in it."
However, My daughter purchased the Miller Chill for a family picnic. One of the worst beers I have ever tasted. I thought maybe it was conflicting with the food I ate at the picnic, so tried another at home. My conclusion was the same.
Appearance pale yellow. Aroma of a slightly lime and something else. Flavor is a little limey, somewhat sweet, lightly acidic. Leaves an aftertaste of something else other than lime. Did they also ad salsa or a taco? Will not purchase it again. 
My Daughter could not finish hers, hence I still have three bottles that will take up space in my bar cooler for years to come.

God, this is horrible. It resembles a benign macro with it’s stupidly fake-looking plastic white head, but inside this simple looking brew is an insidious monster. It smells quite like a mixture of stale urine and that chemical synthetic lime coating that they put on lime-flavored Doritos. At first taste, you think that you have regurgitated a bit of your own vomit. It is  reminiscent of that post vomition mouth feel that you have after drinking too much tequilla and lime on top of way too much beer. Each nauseating sip solicited the desire to throw up. I simply could not finish this beer and down the drain it went. My garbage disposal even had trouble swallowing this bile.

pale, pale yellow. beer should not be this color. aroma seems like a combination of ivory and dial bar soap. beer should not smell like soap. the lime thing isn’t working because the flavor doesn’t stay lime-y.  it drags in off flavors. not sure how this passed the taste-testers and focus groups at Miller.

Bottle. Head is initially small, frothy/fizzy, white, mostly diminishing. Body is clear light yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (grain), with notes of artificial lime and apple candies, heavily scented detergent, DMS. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. It’s kinda like Sprite with Tide detergent added (or is that Bounce fabric softener?). Very weird and unpleasant, perhaps even carcinogenic in large amounts?

Okay. This was not nearly as bad as I was expecting it to be. With that said, tho, it was still pretty darn bad. It poured a very pale yellow. Slight smell of limes. Taste was pretty much watered down lime juice and a bit of salt. Left a huge lingering lime flavor in the mouth. Not awful. I would not seek it out, however, I would drink it above all the other low end crap out there.

Nothing really interesting here tastes like ass ( assuming thats what ass tastes like) barely a lime taste which i give the flavor a 2 insted of a 1 salt is aweful luckily I didnt buy this 6 pack of crap, but ill drink it again painfully if nothing else is available.

Hey, pretty much anything that will cover up the crappiness of Miller Lite is welcome, so the limes are a good thing in my book.  Drinkable, way better than regular light beer, but still nothing I would buy.
I had this back in march in arizona. Its really not all that bad if your looking for something cool and refreshing. Make sure its cold though, and a little bit of salt goes well with it.

Pours to a thin pale golden body with a dense white head.  The color is thin and nasty.  The aroma is light and not very good.  Notes of pale malts and light limes.  The flavor is a lime infused pale malt.  Subtle saltyness.  The palate is thin but refreshing.  Simple, but better than some other Miller products.
Ugh!......the lime flavoring in this beer is atrocious.  Just go ahead and add a real lime into a crappy beer if that’s your style.  This stuff is crap.

bottle . .  pours light golden with a soda fiz head . . aroma is wheat, metallic, slight lime, and ZIMA . . tastes like you mixed a zima with a high life . . not very good . . you want beer and lime? just add it to a standard mexican cerveza and leave it at that . .
The pour is a clear light yellow with a fizzy white head.  Aroma has a grainy quality with lime added.  Tastes like a lime flavored childrens aspirin.  The palate is weak and thin.
Bottled. Pretyt much your standard "Cerveza" lager, plus lime. I could probably put a few away, but it’s nothing extraordinary.
(bottle) pale gold with nice white head and some lace. Artificial citrusy aroma - not really lime per se. Not much flavor.

12oz Green Bottle

What the heck is this?  Light golden ale color with a thin head.  The aroma was that of being shy of nothing.  Very faint nose.  The flavor was weak and the salt and lime was not very present.  This was a weak attempt at making a fun beer.  Good luck Miller,

12 oz bottle... has to be one of the worse beers ever.  I love a good cervasa, but this tasted like miller lite with lime and a lot of salt added.  the only thing that would have made it worse was if it was in one of those plastic bottles.

I love lime and salt, and was disappointed in the flavor.  Besides being a little tarter than some beers I didn’t taste the lime, or for that, the salt.  Thank heavens I found the Michelob Lime Cactus!

12 oz bottle. I  really struggled to finish this one. This is probably one of the least enjoyable beers I have drank in a very long time. I love beer, and usually can find something I like in just about every style I try. That just was not the case with Miller Chill. The  dull and artifical lime and salt taste that is suppose to replicate a michelada, has much to be desired. This beer pours to a very bright, pale golden color, with a tall, rocky, white head, and a vibrant carbonation. The nose on this beer is faint with dull lime aroma, and light pale malt. The body is thin and fizzy, with a light pale malt body, with a dull lime taste that is not pleasing. This beer finishes with the artifical lime and light pale malt sweetness, then ends with a salty and dull lime flavor that lingers. I found Miller Chill to be a failure. You are better off squeezing some fresh lime juice, and adding some salt to a bottle of Miller Lite. Buyer beware.
Totally awesome sample from low cut dress miller girl at the liquor store. Very fresh, so it didn’t have that stale macro taste.  It was watery and overall pretty gross.  Girl hot, beer not.

Sour salty musty aroma. Lime is not as overpowering as I predicted.  For some reason I expected something quite sweeter and pop like, like tequiza, this is not. Rolling pour with cascading bubbles. Ubiquitous american lager appearance. Has the feel of carbonated water, quite tingly and fizzy. Certainly is built on a pale lager.  More like a fruit beer. Odd hint of salt leaves a unique finish. Not as interesting as I anticipated. Has a craft beer attitude.

Clear and fizzy pale yellow body with an initially impressive white head that falls to nothing in one minute. Aroma of lime soda atop faint grain husks. Faint light beer taste is dominated by artificial lime soda. Fortunately, there’s not enough taste to be truly horrid. Selzer water feel makes it somewhat drinkable if it were dirt cheap which it’s not.

Hold the phone!  Forget for a minute that this is miller.  Forget it’s a macro.  Forget everything you know about beer and just drink it, it’s actually not a bad drink.  It’s a light crisp beer of course, and it has that hint of lime (supposedly salt...but i cant taste that).  It tastes a lot like a corona with a lime.  I’m actually quite impressed by how well they emulated the flavor!  And I know most sophisticated beer drinkers will never have a corona, but I do appreciate the occasional corona.  I’m going against the grain on this.  It’s better than the ratings would make you believe. It’s not perfect, but it’s one of my favorite miller beers.

bottle. first one taste differnt and you are wanting the normal taste of beer. the more you drink the worse the beer gets. very high head. much of the lime flavor rises to the head. get very bad fast.
Very limey!  I am not impresed, nor was I expecting to be.  It just tastes like an ordinary watery beer with stale lime overpowering the non-existant taste.
sample dixie cup at a a liquor store. very weak and watery but actually fresh tasting, but gross tasting too. too much lime makes this taste like drinking a lime soda, very fizzy and gross.

Very weak, light yellow pour with short lived bleached white head.  Smell is mostly sweet lime, and slightly margarita like.  Taste is watery, salty, sweet, a little of lime.  Nothing great, but barely drinkable.  I probably like this better than miller light, but who cares...  Better than some stuff of the serious crap I’ve had, but not by a whole lot.  As one rater stated, it really does taste like a mix of beer and Sprite.

Erin says tastes "limey"
2 1 7 3 13  - 2.6
Drank straight from the bottle.  Nothing special here standard macro beer.  That said it is in my opinion much easier to drink on a hot day than Miller Lite.

Had this at a retirement party staged at the local Hooters, so I’m sure I was financially sodomized for it. Anyway, 12 oz green bottle. Light straw with a very thin white head. Nose of sour corn and light lime - very light nose overall, scents are very hard to discern. Following suit, the "beer" is almost devoid of flavor. Light corny grain tinged with fake lime flavors. Very bland. The salt shows up toward the last 1/3 or so, and frankly it becomes an annoyance. Not so much bad, it’s just tasteless in the beer department. A very "whatever" gimmick beer.
Dear god. Total, utter crap. Like a margarita gone bad...watery, too much lime, too salty. Please stop.

Its a shame to think I actually wasted time pouring this into a glass.  Completely bland, tastes like a cup of water with a pinch of lime and salt.  It might be enjoyable by the bacardi twist/smirnoff ice crowd, but it shouldn’t be classified as a beer.

12 ounce bottle from City Market (July 2007) served freezer-cold from a Hair of the Dog glass.  FUCKK RATEBEER...REAL BEERS DONT HiT ME UP UNLESS U KNOW ME CUZ CHANCES ARE U DON’T TAASTE GOODE.. I GUESS U CAN SAY I GOT A BAD FIRS AROMATIKKS iMPRESSION CUZ I AiNT TRYiNG TO iMPRESS Y0U.. F0R ALL YOU LIME-CHEWIN WETTBAKKS DRINKIN YOU PISSWATER LITE BEER ALL DAY AND RATING THEY ON YOUR COMPUTER..iM GLAD YOU GOT THE COUPLE EXTRA HOURS IN UR DAY TO DO SO, KEEP CHUGGIN UR "HOOKED UP" CHHELADAS, AND WATER’ DOWN CORONASS  OUT ON DA PORCHES BUY HEY IF I WASNT ME, I WOULD HATE MEE TOO. MOST LiKELY I CAN BLAME MYSELF FOR THAT BECAUSE PROBABLY TOOK A COUPLE MINUTES OUT OF MY NiTE TO DRINK UP SUMM BEERS YOU KNOWS OR CARE ABOUTS OR MAYBE A NiTE TO GiVE THAT BEERS TO A NEIGHBOR,COUSIN, SISTER, MOTHER..I GOT NO RESPECT FOR NOTHIN BUT MILLAH PRODUCCTS AND YOU KNOW I’M THE FRUIT BEER KING, DAWG.  

The above review courtesy of Joey Porsche

Single bottle at $1.29. Guess I’m more in the minority on this one and I generally hate macro swills. You’ve already read by others what it looked like
 Here’s why I didn’t hate it. The aroma was a faint lime peel sorta beer = non offensive. It tasted like a cross between a better light beer and sprite,IMO = non offensive. I didn’t even notice the salt. Mine was gone in around 5 minutes so it didn’t suck. Tasted more like a soda than a beer. Certainly better than Miller lite. I’d drink another if it was free at a BBQ. I could see college kids drinkin this at beach party.

Picked up  a single 12-oz bottle from Cellars Wine & Spirits in St Paul, MN. Pours a very light golden blonde brew with a fast dissolving white head that leaves behind a bubbly white ring. The beverage body is very high carbonated, almost a sparkling wine character. Aroma isvery faint and clean with some floral notes and lime zest. Taste is highly carbonated, light bodied with a light white bread and sea salt flavors. Finish is very gritty, no bitterness but a slight lime peel aftertaste. Olé, at least I can say I had this once.

Aroma of lime soda or lime seltzer like Canadian Clearly. A pale yellow gold color with extreme seltzer carbonation and a large fluffy white head. Flavor is artificial lime, sea water, adjuncts and gross malt. This beer finishes bad. This beer is bad.

I was shocked when friends recommended it.  And I was flabbergasted when I actually enjoyed it.  Hmm... the addition of lime and salt to disguise the taste of cheap macro-style light lager.  Not something to drink haphazardly, but the flavors would pair well with fajitas or Japanese teppanyaki....

The bottle label states this is a chelada-style beer.  Chelada is a DARK Mexican beer poured over a 12oz glass of ice, with the juice of a couple of limes, and salt on the rim.   Instead I get a bottle of Miller Lite with a squeeze of not very fresh-tasting lime wedge.  Close enough.   Very cheap pale lager characteristics and lime concentrate.   Limes, by the way, were added originally to hide the skunked hop profile of cheap Mexican pale lagers stored in  clear bottles in tropical climates.
Gross.... Cheap mexican style beer with some lime syrup in it. Overly sweet with bitter and unpleasing taste left over. Just disgusting.

Really we can rate this, Ok take miller lite pour just a touch of roses lime syrup inside a drop of brackish water an bam you have a chill. Hmm this or tequiza what was worse, please BMC’s quit ruining your already lame beers, wtih artifical flavors, hey you know what just start doing wine coolers we could have a whole line up of miller lite infused wine coolers.

12 oz bottle.  This is the kind of beer you drink from a bottle, preferably at a BBQ.  Smelled of fake citrus, supposedly natural.  Tasted like a forced "citrusized" flavor.  Not good at all.  Another attempt by a BMC to take over the whole market.

(bottle - 12 oz) Light straw in color with not much of a head and little carbonation. Smells fruity with a decent amount of citrus. Not much of a beer smell. Flavor has a hint of fake lime with no salt and not much hops. I can’t believe I’m drinking this.

This stuff doesn’t taste like beer. a friend of mind told me it tasted like beer with lime in it. After tasting it I almost wanted to kick his ass since it was my turn to buy a round, I hope no-one saw me carrying them. Underage girls might fancy this drink, it tastes like sprite mixed with rolling rock it’s horrible.

pours a light color with a citrus smell, taste is of miller with some good carbination and a lime snap. aftertaste has a slightly salty flavor, but not a terrible beer all in all. would not buy these myself but if someone else had them i would drink it.

12 ounce bottle.  The pour delivers a lager very light in color.  It reminds me of a sparkling white wine in color and appearance, with a lot of carbonation.  The white head consists of large unstable bubbles that begin to break up immediately.  The head lasts a mere half-minute.  The aroma is a "clean" scent, with slight floral notes and the faintest hint of lemon or lime.

The flavor is more fleeting and ephemeral than the aroma.  Are there really flavors present?  Some swallows deliver hints of pretzel, which accounts for bread and salt flavors.  Some swallows deliver hint of lime.  Some swallows taste like dirty or tainted water.  The finish wavers between almost non-existent and a harsh, almost chemical, finish.

Overall, this beer is rather unpleasant, moreso than I could have ever imagined.  Half of it was poured down the drain.  Even the wife’s homemade tacos couldn’t redeem this beer.  

I definitely will never drink this again.

The only thing interesting with a beer like this is the marketing decisions that went into it.  The beer will likely find a small niche.  It is a light Mexican beer.  Aroma is uniquely Miller and there is a lime flavor.  Other than that there isn’t anything going on.

Bottle-Memphis. two parts beast-lite, one part sprite...or one part miller lite, one part mike’s hard lemonade, and two parts water...thanks for the free beer if you let me drink a few more, I will probably have to give it all back...don’t get none on ya.

Sampled thanks to a girl in a Miller Chill dress at Nick’s Liquor, bumf*ck, IN.  Apparently she does not come with the beer, but that’s ok because I rate her about the same as beer.  She asks "what do you normally drink."  "CRAFT beer" I state clearly.  Well lets see how well this is crafted.  Miller nose that malt (not light struck, these must be fresh bottles) hint of lime and salt.  Fizzy palate limey flavors that I think are not too overdone with the malt but ew that salt.  Salty finish.  She states, "you know you don’t have to finish it."  It’s only two ounces so I do.

Bottle.  Didn’t have to change much to rate this beer....what a disgrace.  Don’t get me wrong, I am a huge fan of Miller products, that is half the reason I condsider this brew a failure.  Fortunatly, I only had to throw a few away...only bought a 6 pack.  What a raunchy "beer".  Very sad Miller would put their name on this.

12 oz. bottle, electric green glass. Smells of sweat from the bottle. Odd haze over basic pale beer color. Taste is mostly sweat and Sprite. There was a distributor in my town that for a while carried a nonalcoholic malt drink called "Ten High," but it was overdone on citrus and tasted like a grainy Mountain Dew. It was still better than this.

Dear sweet fictional son of a made up deity why???  Ok, I can completely wrap my head around adding salt and lime to a pale lager to, I don’t know, add some sort of flavor to an otherwise worthless glass of carbonated malt water.  But why in crap would someone be attracted to a "lite" beer artificially flavored with crap lime sweetener and whatever the crap they’re using for salt?  Seriously, it’s like someone took a crappy lite beer and added rose’s lime and msg.  Whose dumb ass idea was this?
