This doesn’t look too bad, a pale yellow body with a tall fizzy head, but it smells like a lime soda with a bad attitude.  I s’pose the flavor is what they were going for, a Mexican lager with lots of lemon juice.  But, why?

Repeat Personal Milestone - Pale Lager rating #300 (out of 3565)!!!!!

Single bottle purchase from Pat’s Liquors, Porter, IN.

Not sure what Chelada is and the beer is not good enough to warrant researching further. The beer is a pale yellow-gold color with a thin bone white head. Very little lacing is apparent. Aroma of lime hard candy and mild malt. Light-bodied with a flavor similar to any lemon-lime carbonated beverage. Only the barest hint of any hops or malt flavor. The finish is carbonated and citrusy. Pretty worthless overall.
Come on.  If you want a Corona with lime then get one.  Avoid this..........

Bottle.  There isn’t a whole lot to say.  It’s geared at chompin at the corona market.  Lime and salt mixed with beer.  Maybe good for a really hot day, which it was when I had it.  I don’t think I could personally stomach more than 2 bottles of this at a time, muchless want.
12oz bottle. No where as bad as i thought it would be. Limey, sugary flavored 5 to 6 beer piss colored beer. Drinkable on a hot summer day. sort of a mojito styled beer
12 oz bottle. poured orangey-yellow body with weird lime aroma. Didnt really enjoy this beer. Probably couldnt drink too many of these despite their undeniable smoothness.

Bottle: Clear yellow gold, light head, nice lacing. Nose of citrus, lime and sugar. Some light pale malt. The flavor is full of ascorbic and aspartaney lime. Swill it back. Very thin, no body, light flavor, fairly awful.

Nothing I say in this review can be even remotely illuminating (Miller Chill tastes just as bad as anyone would expect), but I will say this:
I would only drink this beer if someone else had left it in the fridge, everything else had run out, and it was already too late to buy more beer. Unfortunately, these were the exact circumstances of my last encounter with Miller Chill.

people have been telling me to drink this ice cold and i think i know why. golden color with bright white head. has all the charms of macro crap. lots of fake smelling lime candy in the nose. lime taste on the front miller lite in the middle and a faint lingering salty taste on the finish. could have given this a two word review: SHIT SANDWICH

Found this one bottled in Park Forest, Illinois.  I guess I was expecting far worse (a gritty shandy, or something along those lines), so maybe that’s tainting my rating a bit.  Poured a crystal clear, bubbly straw yellow with a bubbly white head, a bit skunky in the nose but nothing terribly unusual, and really tasted a lot like a regular Mexican lager, with the lime already added. That was about it.
Tastes like Sprite. I think this is Miller’s attempt to make their nasty beer taste better, but they went a little overboard with the lime.
had this at a graduation party, all I can say is that I have had more flavor out of a glass of water with a lime slice in it.
So filtered it looks like Dewars and water.  Tastes like Miller Lite with real lime juice and a slight afternote of salt.  Instead, buy a real Cerveza Del Sol, some limes, and some salt.
ghastly......could a macro get any worse?? probably not.....................

Had to have one of these while at a buddy’s playing cards.  It was this or mich ultra.  Neither choice looked that great.  I guess I should have passed on both.   Anyway... poured a light straw color with basically no head.   I didn’t get much from the aroma but a little lime, and perhaps corn.  The flavor was mostly lime, and not real great.  Very watery.  I should have known better.

Straight up pour gives a five finger white head that fades quickly to a thin layer leaving some lace.  Crystal clear pale amber color.  Light-medium carbonation and light bodied.  Lime nose.  Flavor is a slightly tart lime drink, the lime hides any malt or hops, clean finish.  Good lawnmower beer but don’t drink this expecting anything like a beer.  $1.50 for a 12oz bottle from Capital Convenience Concord, NH.

This is some seriously vile shit. I’m talking, when you look up in the dictionary of "drainpour" they have a picture of this crap. Good God this was bad. I guess I’ve been surrounding myself with some decent beer lately because when you get dogshit like this, it’s definitely a wake-up call. An aroma of salt, metal and some kind of limey soap. I almost wanted to turn around and dump the rest of this garbage out, but I soldiered on. Appearance was a pissy yellow, clear, small bubbles with a foamy white head. Mouthfeel was minerally and watery. Flavor was...bad. And not a good bad. But bad bad. How anyone can choke this crap down bottle after bottle gets the Iron Gut of the Year award from me. A flavor of phoney lime juice, and lots and lots of soap. Imagine sprtizing some lime juice on a bar or Irish Spring, stick it in your mouth and suck on it for awhile and you get the idea of this. I’ve had a true michelada style drink at many authentic Mexican and Puerto Rican restaurants and while it’s not a drink I’ll have often, this does not do it justice. If you see this, stay far far away. Drink Bud. Drink Cave Creek Chili Beer. Just don’t drink this unless you like the taste of soap and lime together. Think I’ll go throw the rest of these bottles away.

Pours a very VERY light gold with a tiny white head. Aroma is mild salty lime. Flavor is tart citrus, hops, and salt. Actually I was expecting much worse. Lots of carbonation. Believe me. I have had much worse than this one.

Bouteille verte de 12 oz dégustée chez Mr. Pizza (Gorham, NH). Arôme: Odeur de maïs avec une pointe de lime. Apparence: La couleur est paille avec une faible densité de bulle. Présence d’un moyen col mousseux et d’une fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Léger goût de lime et d’houblons. Courte durée de l’arrière goût. Palette: Le corps et la texture sont mince. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de lime en arrière goût. (Rating #1133)
One of the worst liquids I’ve ever tasted, watery, horrible acidic flavor, and a sour aftertaste.
Transparent, yellow color.  Smell of malt, corn, copper and a hint of lime.  Taste of lime, malt, hops, lemon and minor salt.  Not that bad actually when you have it in a glass.

12 oz neon green bottle:  Pours a clear straw almost water-like with a medium sized white head that lingers for a small time.  Aroma is artifical lime and Miller Lite.  Taste is like you put a small amount of a margarita into a miller Lite.  Palate is bubbly and carbonated with a light salt and lime lingering.  Overall, It’s not as bad a regular miller light.  It’s rather unimpressive to say the least.
Not as bad as expected.  This is a limed up Miller lite.  I guess I could drink this mowing.  Pale yellow  and small white head.

For a domestic Pale Lager I thought this beer was awesome.  Citrusy aroma and pours yellow with a white head that kinda looks like soap water.  Very good, light flavor with a hint of lime and salt.  I drank this out of a lager glass.

Absolutely the worst beer I have ever had the misfortunate to drink.  Unlike a number of beers that I’ve ingested that turned out to be skunked, I believe this one was supposed to smell like someone cooked up a lime with the worst second-rate lager (or worse "malt beverage") you could find on the market. Nothing at all about this was pleasant, and the lime and salt only detracted from the taste to a worse degree than I imagined. Drain pour.

I have made micheladas, I have drank micheladas, this is hardly michelada inspired. Pale yellow body with a white head. The aroma is limeade with hints of corn. The taste has a touch of watered down lime juice with some light corn. Actually, this isn’t bad and is better than just a plain watery, pale lager.

12oz bottle-thanks to Joe/jwc215 pours a foamy white head and pale yellow color.  Aroma is citrus-lime, grain.  Taste-good carbonation is the first impression then corn and lime-sweet, secondary/faint light hops.  A weak Smirnoff ice.
I don’t know why I ordered this at the bar. Tasted like Miller Lite with lime hints. I read the bottle and that was exactly it.

Bottle.  I would venture to call this a fruit beer rather than a pale lager.  There is more lime flavor than typical beer flavors.  That being said, drink it as cold as you can.  Refreshing unless it warms, then it just gets too sweet.
light body, citrus, pale, fizzy,  overall it wasent that bad of beer for a change. was not much alcohol content either.  im sure it tastes better with a lime slice..

Well now, this is kinda boring, but thanks for fruiting my beer at least to spice it up.  Didn’t really catch much of the saltiness, but the aroma and palate was noticeable limey over the usual cereal and cardboard flavored american pale.  Oh, and appearance-wise it was fizzy yellow beer.

12 oz bottle-Light golden/ yellowish coloring. Aroma of light limes and and slight fruity smells, taste is fairl salty/ almost to the point of tasting like someone put line in ocean water.  Very disappointing, and not enjoyable.  Wouldn’t have picked it up myself but someone left it in my fridge.

I saw this at the store and just had to pick it up after i saw it had lime and salt in it. Firs tthing you notice is this very strong and very strange aroma. Definite lime and salt in the aroma and very chemical smelling. Light golden and clear like a usual macro. Flavor is disgusting. Tastes more like a smirnoff or zima than a beer. Definitely pick up the lime and light salt but it tastes wrong and extremely bad. Cant describe it. I couldnt even drink half this beer. Worst beer ever..

Pours a very light yellow color. Very noticeable lime/citrus aroma. Flavor is strong lime, a little lemon, and a slight hint of salt.  Not good, not bad, just very different. You have to really like the idea of koolaid in a beer to appreciate this one.
Not sure how "natural" the flavors and aromas are in this one. Basically a light beer and lime squishee jammed together. Not impossible to get down the throat, but pretty bad.

Sample at the liquor store.  This blatant marketing scheme was about as terrible as you would think.  It was a pale lager with lime and salt.  The lime and salt didn’t blend well but just sort of masked the beer.

Among the Imperial Stout crowd here (God, do you guys drink anything else?) this beer will not rate well. Double the average number for a real number. 

This is a gimmick beer, but unlike Tequiza, this one works. Great for a summer at the beach. It’s refreshing and tastes nice on the tongue. It’s a chick beer, you could say, but I’d take this over a Corona with lime any day of the week.
Meh. Lime flavored pale lager, extra watery. Extremely thin on flavor and body. Is this low-carb or something? There’s really nothing to it. Blech.
Great new beer from Miller. I was a little skeptical, b/c I don’t like green beers too much. This beverage is very refreshing.

Got this at a party tonight.  I was curious.  Pale colored, no head.  The nose is like a jolly rancher.  Goes down like water with lemon.  Wouldn’t suck on the beach if only because I’d be on the beach.

nose reminded me of lime chuckles candy. big head and lace, but (don’t shoot me), I reused the glass from another beer. Talk about thin! Pah. pale in color than the cadaver of an albino. Yak. I be pasing on dis.

bottle - This beer is pale, clear yellow with a mild aroma of limes.  The flavor continues the lime theme.  It’s obviously lime and a little salt dumped into a largely characterless lager.  Maybe I was just looking for something light and refreshing at the time though because I didn’t completely hate it.  It’s certainly easy to drink and doesn’t taste bad.  Adding too much lime is actually an improvement for Miller beer.

Well, it tastes kind of like a German Radler, except that the base beer is far crappier. You know it goes down pretty easy and doesn’t taste all that vile. If it is around I will drink it without too much hesitation.
I actually like this beer and can drink quite a few of them.  Something that you could use to wash down some BBQ...worth a try!!!

Pale yellow color with a wispy taller white head. Certainly smells like limeade. Perhaps a hint of bread dough, but the nose is more like a margarita than a beer. Pale malt and lime flavors from the start. Quite fizzy and slightly watery in feel. A radler with lime instead of lemon. No need for this on for me, not even with mexican cuisine on a hot day.
Light yellow and no head. Aroma is weak, with some citric notes. Flavor is an awful mixture of miller, lime and salt. Had to try it just to try it- oh well

Pale yellow with a minimal head.  Aroma is a  vague whiff of grain and citrus.  Flavor is watery lite beer with a mild sweet citrus background.  Completely forgettable.  I guess it’s not horrible but I can’t believe that Miller is charging over $6 for a six pack.

Took the dive and sampled one of these at a graduation party.  A weak, watery yellow color with no head.  Next to no aroma and not a good one at that.  Tastes like a lime-injected No idea what Chelada style means, but I’m sure Miller nailed it in a cheap, pandering manner.
Pours a watery-pee color.  Has a small citrus taste up front and then finishes with a light malty taste.  Kinda weird.  It tastes like chemicals.
This is not so great. Basically they just took a lager and dumped a lot of lime in it and sold it like that. Glad the were doing a sampling at the beer store.

Tastes like the aftertaste of Fruitty Pebbles.  
Not good in any way shape of form.
The worst SAB offering I’ve had.
Seriously, overall this is not a bad beer.  Frattastic sure, but man, I can drink a thousand of these in one sitting.

Bottle at Montgomery Inn Boathouse. Poured clear light pale color with an average rocky white head that mostly diminished. Light sour citrus aroma. Light body with a watery texture with soft carbonation. Light sweet & sour flavor with a sweet finish of short duration. Drinkable summer brew.
well.. it’s better than miller light.. kinda like 1/2 carona w/ lime and half miller light... just not very good.

Pours a clear bright golden with a frothy white head that dissipates rather quickly. Aroma is lime and grass. Flavor was actually refreshing lime and a hint of salt. The finish is a bit papery and short. This was a pleasant surprise and is good on a hot summer day.

Bottled... thought I’d calibrate the palate (or some stupid thing).  Poured clear bright golden with a quickly-receding white head and scattered, aggressive rising carbonation.  Aroma was basically watered down lime and salt... certain insipid wet grains deeper into it.  Flavor had a wet grainy base with somewhat fresh lime and salt.. wet cardboard on the finish with lime dropping off quickly.  Light-bodied and dry on the palate.  This could have been worse.

OK, so it’s not a classic. No, Miller did not make a real breakthrough here. No, it’s not something that Michael Jackson [the beer guy, not the other one] would crave. I don’t even like Miller beer. But I liked this one. I had just finished trimming some trees on a hot afternoon, and I cracked open one of these - and it went down just fine, thank you. The second was just as tasty as the first. Can I or will I drink a lot of it? No. But as a fan of Corona & Lime, this one is cheaper and IMHO, tastier.

Oh, and by the way, I drank it ice cold right out of the bottle! Blasphemy!! In all honesty, I can’t image pouring this one in a glass or it being on tap.

Pours like any other pale lager, but it smells like rotten rose’s sweetened lime juice. Already been said, but this really does taste a lot like Diet 7-up, only not quite as sweet. No aftertaste, and a watery palate. Guess that’s what they’re aiming for, but I’d rather just have a 7-up. Thank god I didn’t have to pay for this.

Pre-RBSG Milwaukee: Bottle: Poured a clear yellow with a white head. Aroma was strong artificial lime and a nice assy quality to it. Flavor was identical to diet 7-up, we did a side by side. But the seven up smells better.

This one did have some lime aroma and flavor, and I admit that and score for that, but it tastes like a watered down margarita.  Either have a margarita, or have a good beer; hell, even have a pussy beer if you wish, but stay away from this crap.  The only salt I tasted was from the sweat running down the bridge of my nose into my mouth on a 90 degree day out on my deck.  My sweat tasted better than this monstrosity.

Okay, so this is supposed to be a pale lager?  I’m not sure this is a beer.  Kind of fruity smelling and pretty clear.  Reminds me of a wine cooler, with artificial flavoring and coloring.  Not much else here.

Bottle, split with NachlamSie. Pours light greenish yellow with thin white head. The aroma is skunky at first, but it goes away after a minute; then margarita mix and corn. The flavor is something like lawn clippings dumped into a cheap margarita. Lime and corn water in the finish. Not good at all.

Bottle split with Tronraner. This stuff pours grossly. It’s extremely light and see through with a strange neon tint to it. The nose is bad. It’s like a cheap margarita with lime Jello. Some token paper, corn, and faint skunk are also present. The artificial lime taste is predominant in the beer which actually makes it soda-like and obnoxious, but not quite nauseating. It has a finish much like 7 Up. Imagine taking 7 Up and dropping some swill in there. This beer is dumb.

This beer is only mediocre by itself. The trick is to add real lime juice to it and it is awesome. Pours like any average domestic beer and has the same appearence. But it beats Miller’s other lineup by far. I say give it a try with lime juice. It beats Corona as well.

Sampled from a Playboy chalice.....A pale yellow appearance with a white soapy head. The aroma is lemon lime kool aid and dishwashing detergent. The flavor contains hay, corn, lemons, with a bitch smack of lime in the finish. The mouthfeel is carbonated and it’s pretty close to eating liquid soap with a bit of slime on the tounge. Needless to say this is not good.

Bottle.   Lime and salt aroma.  Pale yellow with a small head.  Lime and salt flavor - maybe the lime is throwing me but maybe a hint of agave as well .  Like an extremely watered down margarhita which is most likely what Miller was going for (besides ripping off A-B’s Tequiza).  Nothing bad here - just nothing beer-like.  Like a light version of a mixed drink I make - one shot of Tequila, 1/2 shot of Rose’s lime juice with the rest of the glass filled with mineral water - has more of a kick besides a better taste.
not bad not great you would never drink this in the winter . i only hope that corona drinkers would try this instead of the most overpriced beer in history that drives woman crazy . corona

Neighbor broke this stuff out and thought it was the invention of the century so I couldn’t be rude so I smilingly excepted his gift. Golden yelloish foamy white head, so far looks like miller, aroma is lime and miller. You could definitely tell this was a miller lite with a very sweet lime like flavor. I actually thought higher of it then regular Miller lite but don’t look for it on my grocery list.

I spent approximately two weeks working at a nearby liquor store (which shall remain unnamed) and during that agonizing tenure as a cashier I saw many, many six and twelve packs of Miller’s gecko green novelty go across my counter.  It was a very hot series of days, and the store was giving away flimsy Warsteiner glasses with each six pack, but most people seemed to be enamored by the idea of a lime-less Corona – a minimal effort hot summer beer to help the sweat glands cool the sultry drinker down.  I walked home with a six pack that day knowing that I could take one bottle and the family would guzzle down the rest.  Taking a seat outside in the hot noon sun I poured it into a standard pilsener glass and gave it a go.  I was immediately reminded of a Dairy Queen Limeade – a staple of my youth.  There is a definite outline of the standard pale lager modus operandi, with all the resplendent corn and buzzing carbonation, but there was also copious lime flavors.  Problem was, Miller attached only the sweet parts of the lime and omitted the tangy, bitter and sour parts.  In other words, they made a beer with a “citrus flavor” and omitted the citrus flavor.  It seems to me that abjuring the focal point of one’s beer is not a poor brewing chpice.  Without the tangy half of the lime this was nothing more than Lime candy melted in beer.  It was refreshing on some level, but any cold liquid would do in its place.  I was expecting a drink to transport me to Baja or the Caribbean, but the Miller Chill Chelado Style was nothing more than a trip to the local Walgreen’s for a six pack of Miller Light and a handful of lime sour patch kids.  Customers ranted and raved, calling it the newest and best way to beat the heat, but for me this is nothing more than a marketing attempt to fill the niche Tequiza left.  I hope said niche empties again quick.

Clear straw color with a large head. Little retention, spare lacing. Aroma of sweet malt and lime. You’re kind of expecting a corona with lime taste, but...there’s the salt. Very unsettling at first. But it does get a bit better as you work through it. Gotta agree with a previous review; it tastes like lime Gatorade. Maybe with a touch of soylent green.
tasted at bevmo. I didn’t taste any lime, but maybe that’s good. this was piss poor

From a lime green twist-off 12 oz. bottle with a freshness date on the neck, sampled ice cold in a shaker glass.

Poured a clear pale yellowish golden with a frothy white head, very active carbonation, minimal amount of laced sticking which surprised me.

Aromas of adjuncts, corn and cereal, a light lime zestiness and chalk.

The mouthfeel reminds me of Miller Lite, crisp, dry and thin, light bodied.

I didn’t care for the taste of this, a phony, chalky saltiness and artificial lime flavoring, like a lime pixie stick, the lime seems to amp up the corn and cereal tastes, otherwise, very thin sweet macro lager maltiness, and a dry chalky, lime soda-like finish. I also thought this is rather harsh in the palate, unpleasant to drink. Even on this hot and muggy summer day, this does nothing for me, I’m liking it less and less.

A Miller sales rep was working the liquor store where I purchased a six of this, he told me Miller considers this a "couples" beer, something to order when out on a summer date, or relaxing with your spouse on a quiet evening in the backyard. In my household, it failed on all counts, my girlfriend dislikes Chill even more than I do. I would rather have a crappy Corona and just use a fresh lime slice, much preferable to drinking another bottle of this.

I’ve had much better, and many worse, was expecting undrinkable crap, but to my surprise, it reminded me of many radlers I’ve had in Germany, easy drinking, especially as a thirst quencher, nothing else, reminds me of a soda.

HUGE THANKS TO SLIFFY! Here we go... #1000. Giggity giggity goo. Clear golden yellow color, shimmering with the light of the lamp in the room we are drinking in. Its glorious. The head rose to monstorous proportions reminiscent of a miller lite or perhaps even a budweiser. The clarity is nothing short of astounding. The normality of corn and all sorts of adjuncts is replaced by the pure, and unadulterated smell of crap. Not literal crap. But crap in the sense that this in no way smells good or in the least way decent. Its apparent and obvious, like JK’s love of GW or Turbos love of homosexuals, its that obvious. And then like a lovers embrace (or a hookers) the beer hits your lips like a magic intertwining moment of clarity. Here we go lime baby. In fact thats the only thing I can possibly discern of this pittle-posh. And with 1000 beers rated, and sitting around with folks from 4 different states, I leave you with peace on earth, and a good giggity.

(Bottle) Pours a fizzy light yellow color, with no head. Lots of lime flavor. Tasted like a malternative. Weak palate, not unlike every other Miller product I have ever had. Actually not as bad as I expected on a 95 degree day though...

I have a beer geek friend who really liked this beer, so I finally tried a bottle at his place. I’ve gotta say, it is what it is and is really not awful. Like many people have said already, it’s simply Miller Lite with some artificial sweet lime flavor mixed in the aroma and the flavor. Much better when ice cold. I didn’t taste any salt in this beer. The lime was mostly lime Jolly Rancher or Skittles, either way not the most natural taste. I’d drink this 50 times before I’d drink a Bud Light.
Mixing Miller Lite with the taste of lime and salt?  Bad choice.  Mixing Miller Lite with anything...bad choice.  Miller Lite...Bad Choice.

very pale gold, almost white, with a large sudsy white head.  lightly sour lager aroma with maybe a hint of lime.  flavors of sweet lime and green jello.  this stuff is rough man.  this is going to be one hard 6-pack to finish.  i couldn’t agree more with 17floor.  my purchasing experience was very similar too.  how embarrassing.

I didn’t want to buy a 6 pack either!  I finally snuck into 7/11 at 2am and picked one up when no one was looking.  I’ve never said this of any beer... but this is definitely a drain-pour.  REDICULOUSLY BAD!  The malt is so foul that it tastes like throwup after-taste, probably because the lime is in there.   .......o and I’ve found the flavor... it is lime jello before you fridge it.   Get some and compare, I’m spot on.  
[EDIT] haha if you click on "highest ratings" theres about two or so pages of VERY HIGH ratings of people with only 1 rating... this is miller marketing trying to save some face on here... i’ve done major alcohol rollouts/marketing and this is a classic tactic.  rediculous

Consumed cold from a bottle after playing tennis - take this rating with a grain of salt!  Light bodied sweetish flavor with a limey fruit mix thrown on top.  I know this isn’t anything quality but it tasted good.  I really didn’t pick up any obvious salt flavor.

I sure didn’t want to buy a 6pack of this, so every Friday I’ve been asking the bartenders at Ray’s "did ya get the Chill yet?"  Finally, last Friday was my "lucky" night.  Poured a light gold, short fizzy head. Didn’t look very carbonated, but palate was very fizzy.  Lime and corn aroma.  Taste was light beer with fake lime juice.  I didn’t taste any salt like the label said.  Ended with a very plastic/chemical aftertaste.  I’d avoid this one if I were you.

faintly yellow color, with a tiny little white head.  Aroma is that of my bathroom in college when my friendss drank too much (vomit).  Wow, but seriously it does smell like vomit, and a little wonderbread.  Unusual flavor of lime,  well...........thats about it.  It is an interesting beer to say the least.  Imagine Corona with the lime bud worse.  I would much rather swill a miller than this creation, at least miller balances a lack of flavor, as opposed to flavor that is terrible.
it was not that great of a beer.  too much lime flavor.  it tasted like a flat 7up.  no beer flavor at all.

Miller Chill
12 oz bottle
Recent brewing, chilled 06/07
Moderate pour in a shaker.

Poured a clear yellow with a moderate quickly diminishing white fizzy head.

Smelt of moderate lime and faint white bread.

Taste was upfront moderate sweet and sour lime followed by more of the same on a long horrible stale lime twist corn chips finish.

Palate was light bodied, fizzy, watery and lightly puckering.

Overall, I could give this higher points, but I just truly cannot enjoy this beer.  The only beer aspect of it is its slight grain taste and beer-like appearance, but otherwise its more like a light malt beverage.  I’d rather buy a lime for 25cents and throw it in a macro, as least I would get some fresh produce flavor in my mouth.

Free bottle. You get what you pay for. Bright yellow with hardly any head. I dont get the salt flavor. What I do get though is a nice lemon/lime taste that doesnt taste too artificial. Tastes like a watered down 7-Up. Not disgusting or horrible but not enjoyable either.

Single bottle, from Total Wine.  There are many things in this world that are meant for sucking.  Vacuum cleaners, street sweepers, lollipops, those tubes at the drive thru banks.  Then there is this beer.  From the get go, the beer has suck written all over it.  Green bottles are well known to have terrible beers inside.  This one joins the ranks as another American beer idea gone terribly wrong.  Don’t waste your cash on this beer, because you will be disappointed.  Shame on you Miller, this beer was offensive and whoever green lighted this effort deserves a 100% paycut and a year’s supply of this crap.

Bottle. Smells like a urinal cake. Tastes of wam, stale MGD with some sort of sour/salty flavoring. I don’t know what the hell "chelada style" beer is but get it the hell away from me. The rating system is unfair in this case, as I’m not allowed to give a ZERO.
A beer that is essentially good only on hot days.  Reminds me of Zima.  Slightly salty aftertaste.  Very easy to drink...that’s about it.
very light, easy to drink on a hot day, not a true "mexican" beer, too artificial, but not as much as Tequiza, which I found way too sweet for my taste.

Miller really didn’t try too hard when making this stuff.  Even though I tasted this beer when it was ice cold, it still tasted like warm Corona.  I am not sure if that is a good or bad thing.  I guess it will do when you are partying it down on Cinco de Mayo and your local liquor store runs out of Corona.  Or, if it is free.  The headaches are tbe dull kind.  No stomach problems at all.
Had this at a BBQ today.It was Miller’s version of Corona.Not too sure why anyone would want to clone that beer.Flavor was of artificial lime as was tyhe finish.just another macro POS
this just wasn’t very good. tasted like fake lime. how did the ratings get this high?

Can you really call this a beer? It ruined my whole evening.  Two days later and I still can’t get the taste out of my mouth. I’ll make my young sons drink this, so they will hopefully stay away from beer for a few more years. Salty finsh that can’t combat the artificial lime taste very well.
This beer made me crave a gobel or a blatz even a hamms give me a red whtie &blue or even PBR me A.S.A.P who ever came up with this idea should be ran over by a beer truck right away....

Sometimes you expect something to be awful and it is as awful as you expected it to be. Sometimes you expect something to be horrid and it surprises you by only being bad. Sometimes you expect something to be offensive to you in every way and yet it somehow manages to be worse than you imagined. Cheers to my first 0.5 rated beer.
Not bad, slightly salty finish. Best when very cold. Not a corona w/ lime, but better than I had anticipated.

First taste 6/4/07.  Someone brought a sixer of these to a cookout at my house and there was one left over, so I had it with takeout sushi last night.  Had it straight from the bottle so I can’t evaluate the pour.  Has an artificial lime taste with salty undertones.  Its downfall is its sweetness and the overall artificial feel.  I dare say I even got a bubblegum aftertaste, though it could have been a bad mix with the spicy sushi I was eating.  Did anyone else get this?  Overall, not very good.  I don’t think Corona has much to worry about.

Couldn’t even finish one bottle it was so bad.  Maybe I’m bias cause I feel Miller is the single worst brewery in the world but this was just brutal.   Artificial lime flavor, salty - hello this is a beer not a margarita, and just plain bad.  No self respecting beer drinker would be caught dead with it!

I’m not a fan of mexican beer, and this is basically just a beer Miller is throwing out there to compete with the Corona’s.  Aroma- a faint lime. Flavor- is kind of sour and salty.  Overall it isnt terrible, it will sell a ton, and it will be the "it" beer to have at all the parties this summer (kind of like Sunset Wheat last year, though that is much better), but you wont find me drinking it.

Tastes like a meal at chili’s. I can taste the granulated lime and the corn syrup. I hope someone goes to hell for this. Flat out, I hope they suffer eternally in a lake of fire with the gnawing and gnashing of teeth. After half a beer I’ve got plenty of chilada pouring out of my ass.
Pours a straw yellow with a white head. The only aroma I could pick up was of lime. Huge lime taste followed by sweet cereal/wet grain taste.

Pretty much aall corn and wet grain aroma,hard to pick up any of the lime here,taste was adjunct with a slight mild lime finish,I didn’t think the aftertaste was that bad,would probaly make a nice palate cleanser during a tasteing session

Very light body-water with just a hint of yellow. When poured, an attractive, thick, and foamy white head appears, but it quickly fades to a viscous film. I give it a 3 on appearance because the film sticks around. Nose-cardboard, very faint skunk. To be honest, I was expecting much more fruitiness in the nose. Taste-tastes like a light beer. I was expecting some saltiness and lime, but the only thing that I get, besides cheap light beer flavor, is just a hint of a hint of lime. At least Tequiza doesn’t hide it weird flavor additions. The nose is bad all the way around-the worst smells in a macro are here-they didn’t even put in enough lime to cover that up.  Finishes with an artificial slap. And last time I checked, it is spelled "chilada" and it is a divine dish served at Bueno, not some POS marketing gimmick. Bastards.

Was given this at a party, and the other choice was Coors, so Chill it is. Drank from the bottle, so I can’t say what it looked like. Smelled like lime soda. Taste is watered down lime soda. Finishes like any other pale lager. A noble effort, and probably good on a very hot day, but nothing to go out of your way and try.
(Bottle) Super limey taste with little color, almost like a wine cooler, neat looking bottle but I don;t think it will last.

Pours an extremely pale yellow with a creamy-looking, thin head.  Smells like limeade, sweet and cloyingly limey.  Taste is overpowering with lime, but the sort of lime flavor you get from a key lime candy.  Finishes with a touch of crappy miller lite flavor.  Somehow wound up being even more lime-flavored than i would have imagined.  Vaguely tastes like a miller lite with margarita mix thrown in. As bad as you would expect.

Bottle poured a deep yellow with a decent, fizzy head.
Aroma is lime,corn and grass.
Flavor is a bit of an overkill on the lime with a sweet lime finish.

So I’m out cutting the lawn last Sunday and it’s a fairly hot and humid day for late April. My father-in-law brings over a 6’er of this stuff thinkin’ I’ll like it I guess. He realizes I’m a beer geek/fanatic but unfortunately doesn’t realize the difference between "good" beer and "gimmick" beer. So I swilled a couple cold ones down to quench my thirst and it definitely served its purpose; but I guess ice water or iced tea would have had the same results. Anyway it was light, crisp, limey, quite thin and watery and all and all not much different than a Corona with a lime stuffed in the bottle. Nothing overtly offensive here, just another gimmicky mass produced swill they can make more dumb-ass commercials about.

From a 12 Oz Bottle. A sniff from the neck yields a saccharin rotting corn and lime rinds. Appears to be a rather clear pour. Flavor begins with stale corn and swiftly slides into a repugnant fake lime juice. I think the salt provides illusion of body for a beer that would typical come across as water. Tastes like I put a lime in a Corona and let it sit in the hot sun for an afternoon. Skanky, sleazy and over-advertised.

POSITIVE -- I did try it and I liked it Very much. Called some friends, they tried it last weekend, they liked it and so did their visiting relatives.  I liked it enough to google it. Sorry to see negative opinions especially from those who haven’t even popped a top. Now if you are a die hard german beer lover or anything close - all the heavy bitters etc. - you know this is not the beer for you. There is a vast # of taste buds, what may taste great to you doesn’t work for me and so it goes. If everyone liked A one and only beer, what a bloody boaring world this would be. Any beer can turn skunky if it’s old, if it’s been left out in the heat "get the beer out of the trunk and into the fridge" or hey man, you could buy one of those things man, it hold ice, keep the beer cold. Yup, it’s rocket science. As far as packaging - having a DTP background I think the design & packaging really works! But then again I’m not the sort to NOT buy a beer and try it cuz of how the outside looks. I like trying new things, you wanna be stuck in yur rut well - "nay sayers", go, be gone with ya, just leaves more for me - and folks like me - thanks.

I thought "Miller Chill" a very crisp clean taste. Seasonal? I think it a great spring, summer, fall beer. No, can’t see myself drinking it in the dead of winter but then again, a fire at the ski lodge, ya-maybe. I hope it goes nation wide as I don’t live in the state(s) it is produced. I would go buy some for this weekend if it were available. I like what I like and will buy what I like and you’ll do the same. 

To each his own...live life...be free..choices in the good old USA !!!!
A poor imitation of a mexican beer with lime.... Color of piss...taste non existant...
What can i say?   It’s exactly what it says on the bottle.  Light beer with lime flavor.  If that’s your thing, you’ll love it.  That’s not my thing!
Bring to Milwaukee / waukesha area - tryed in texas and loved it.  WIll buy if I see it

terrible. a marketing strategy that worked with my vacationing family in Florida. Call something cold, put a lime on the bottle, and provide a lemon-lime type beverage that tastes more like five alive than beer.
Great beer, amazing aftertaste, love the citrus taste, better than Corona and you don’t need to look for a lime!  Goes great with food.

12oz bottle. Seen this advertized at Hooters but they were out. So last trip to beer store seen it in bottle. Lime grainy aroma. Yellow body with white head. Lime carbinated soda that was harsh on the palate. This is awful. Hate to waste to beer but this was almost a drain pour.
Lime citrus aroma.  pours pale blonde.  It reminds me of a shandy, maybe Steigel Raddler, but a little salty?  Not sure why you’d want a lime and salt flavored beer?

wtf is this? they want to put lime and salt in a beer? i can do that myself if i want to, it’s not THAT hard. 
what’s next, pre-buttered bread?
electric can-openers?
digital banana peelers?
are we getting so lazy?

Miller Chill has a citrus smell/taste and is very thirst quenching, especially on hot days.  The appearance it catchy - Mexican fiesta southwest theme.  The flavor is suprisingly great, just the right mix of lager and citrus.  Imagine squirt and MGD mixed at just the right ratio.  Worth trying especially if you like Corona and Dos Equis.
i got this beer last night, it was very easy to drink but the flavor got tiresome. the lime taste overpowerd the beer. easy to drink and good on a hot day
i like the bottle/label? some strange limey smell...better than i was expecting...good on a hot day but offers nothing exciting...

12 oz bottle.  Pale yellow with decent white head.  Aromas were yeasty and didn’t really give away what was about to be tasted.  What ended up being tasted was strange actually.  Lots of lime flavor.  Some salt.  It was like drinking a corona with extra extra extra lime squeezed in.  Remember Tequiza?  it was slightly better than that.  Actually kinda refreshing, and I could see a non beer drinker enjoying this.  I think I might have called it a fruit beer though.

I had one of these miller chill beers last night and it was very good , you could taste the hint of salt and lime and, this beer is definately worth trying if your a miller lite , mgd, or miller high life drinker. I hope they keep it on the market especially in san antonio, texas. cold beer cold beer!!

Let me start off by saying that you have to take this beer for what it is.  It is not intended to be a "beer-beer", but an easy drinking beer that is intended for the average drinker.  When you look at it through that perspective, it is a phenomenal beer.  This product has a nice lime aroma, very drinkable, and finishes extremely smooth.

Nice job on this product, and I can’t wait to enjoy it all summer.

Bottle... AWOL ’07... Clear straw-colored lager with a large, wispy, white head. Yeasty, citrusy nose with peppery hops and lot of lime. I hate lime! Lime and sweet canned corn flavor. Hops? Too little; too late. Medium-bodied and lightly creamy with fizzy carbonation. Sweet, limy finish.
